I could watch it a thousand times over (which, I garuntee you, I have) and still not tire of it.A sit-back-and-enjoy-the-ride kind of film, don't do the mindless thing as other reviewers here have and compare it to THE GODFATHER or GONE WITH THE WIND. As I've had to remind several people--IT'S MADE TO BE ENJOYED!Definitely comparable to the INDIANA JONES movies (yet exceeding them immensely), I'd recommend it to anyone who loves action, adventure, humor, romance, and/or Ancient Egypt! Set perfectly in the 1920's, THE MUMMY starred a group of "nobody" actors who are now getting to be somebodies in Hollywood.A perfect 10 for a movie night with friends, or alone on a Tuesday night. (Just don't go near the sequel!!!!!!!!)

An excellent film, regardless of it's historical accuracy. I watched it today and really enjoyed it. I seriously do recommend you watch it.If you enjoy an action-adventure film with a few jumpy bits thrown in then this is a definitely must-watch, as I watched the DVD version I do not know what the cut version is like. It even contains a bit of Ancient Egypt at the beginning and Seti I.This film is not one of those where it gets good near the end, this film is amazing from the very beginning. The prohibited love between Imhotep and Seti I's daughter, murder of Seti I and the mummifying Imhotep and his followers alive at the beginning to the big fight at the end. If you buy or watch this film you will not regret it.

I remember seeing this movie in the early 2000's on rented DVD. Movie is a complete entertainer in terms of action and adventure. There is non stop action till the very end. The story line and plot are mildly interesting if you are into ancient Egypt and mummy sorts of things. Acting have done their job very pretty well. CGI are at par with that time. You can watch it one fine evening if you are in mood for a India Jones type movie.
The Mummy is one of my favorite movies in my list. It's fantastic movies including story ,picture quality and sound quality. I have to seen more then 10 times of movies.

Mummy was the first adventure horror movie I had ever seen.When The Mummy released in 1999, I was completely unaware of Indiana Jones movies. I thought it was first of its kind. The action, comedy, fun just blew me away.I particularly thought that Brendan Fraser was awesome. When I see this movie now (after seeing Indiana Jones movies) I still experience the same fun as I did back then. Not that I don't like Indiana (7 out of 10) but I find Mummy much more enjoyable. The goodness in the script is you always get a feeling that movie is offering you what it promised;non stop entertainment. Among the cast Brendan Fraser is awesomely funny. Rachel Weisz is cute ( missed her in Mummy 3) John Hannah made me smile whenever he showed up and Arnold Vosloo (The Mummy) was cool. I wish they make more Mummy movies with Stephen Sommers on the Director's seat. If you are a big Indie fan then give Mummy a chance.

Review title: Good action flick; great special effects and good performances.
Review_body: Better than I expected.  Brendan Fraser makes a good Indiana-Jones (with help) type of hero, and the supporting cast was great too.

Review title: Mini Teens Will Find Bits Scary
Review_body: Although this movie was rated as suitable for 12-year olds in the UK, you will probably find 12 year olds of the "not streethard" variety will find bits a bit frightening. (Even some of the adults were looking away for the odd bit!)

The movie was great, sound, art direction, and scenes. But I don't think the movie showed the real life of Egypt in that time. The arabic-speaker actors had a very bad accent, very bad arabic, which decreases the opportunity of giving a live scene for the main place of the movie. The clothes were Turkish, except for the crowd allied to Amnhoteb at the end. The prison was ruled by turkish soldiers, which conflicts with the fact that Egypt was a British colony at this time. Also, Life-after-death concept was really one of the main concepts of Pharaohs. But they never made it, because simply, it is untrue!!

Where are the times when directors were directors, cutters were cutters and screenwriters knew how to create a plot? The ILM creation of the main characters were surprisingly weak, for example the movements of the "hero" seemed incredibly mechanic. On the other hand I was positively impressed by the smooth playing of the rotten actor giving the mummy such a powerful and juicy appearance. A moldy movie for decomposing brains.

This film seems to strive too hard for something it never accomplishes. I won't even begin to go in to all the historical inaccuracies it includes concerning ancient Egypt. The movie tries to capture that "Indiana Jones" feeling- being able to quip in the face of extreme danger. While the special effects are very well done, the plot could have used some more attention. I would only recommend this movie when you have nothing better to do.

The Mummy was surprisingly entertaining. It was pretty funny, and full of action and special effects.  It was not a particularly stimulating film intellectually, but it was great for a Sunday afternoon fun-fest.  I recommend it.

An intentionally campy cross between Indiana Jones and some not-so-scary B horror flicks, but it has some pretty funny lines and is rather entertaining.  All you have to do is keep looking at the screen -- it is full of mindless eye-candy (don't know about the historical references though).

Great fun for fans of campy adventures.  Brendan Fraser was a joy as always, please give us more!  The sandstorm swallowing the plane was great - the bugs really icky and the mummy...juicy!  Since my family and I love the old adventures and great B-movies, this was perfect.  Highly recommend for a grin-producing outing!

Man, what a turkey.  Let me see... $150M on special effects and $20 on plot and acting.  I'm not going to waste a bunch of time commenting on this movie except to say that it was one of the worst pieces of junk I have ever watched.  The acting was terrible, the plot was horrible, the dialog was stupid... the special effects, however, were very good.

The Mummy is complete pants! Badly researched, terribly scripted, and acted with grim disgust by the entire cast. This film stinks as much as it abuses the audience's intelligence. It plagiarises films it so desperately wants to be (Indiana Jones, the English Patient and Aliens) without understanding what made them good - characters not formula. As a result a lot of people die who we don't care for, and without sexual chemistry the romantic comedy is t-e-r-r-i-b-l-y forced. Even the special effects are soulless. The greatest crime though is John Hannah. What is he doing in this film? They can't have paid him enough.

"The Mummy" is a very entertaining movie.  If you like the Indiana Jones style of movie then you will enjoy this one.  "The Mummy" has scenes that will give you chills and ones that will make you chuckle.  It is a very enjoyable and entertaining movie that you should see.

The 1999 version of 'The Mummy' was a big waste of time, effort, and money. Sure, the effects were first rate. The location, the costumes, the cast -- no problem there. But did they have to settle for a sitcom-level story?The absolute cheapest element of film making is the story, and with only some (virtually free) story changes, this movie could have been great. The writer-director, Steven Sommers, chose instead to copy only the most overblown and childish aspects of Spielberg's work and let the story come afterwards, if at all.Example: At one point the heroes, pursued by evil minions, wreck their yellow roadster and escape down a manhole. In the next scene, they're zooming away in the re-incarnated roadster. The Mummy himself couldn't work that quickly.But worse were the mugging, the predictability, the one-liners, and the endless rain of bullets. Brendan Fraser even adjusts a mirror by shooting at it from across a room. No, I'm not kidding.Remember the previews? They showed only serious action/adventure; that's what I expected to see. As you can imagine, my hopes were dashed, wrapped, desiccated, and entombed. Don't share that fate! This is one movie to miss.

Review title: Not bad, but was Imhotep really EEEVIL?
Review_body: Normally, I don't much care for 'scary movies.'  This one only marginally falls into that category.  It was somewhat spoofish.  Plot was reasonably predictable, humor somewhat adolescent (which meant that I liked it).My only problem with the film was that I found it very hard to see the Mummy as *EEEEVIL*.  Obsessed, yes.  Insane, probably.  But evil?  He was far too sympathetic a character to dislike, and in the end, Arnold Vosloo's voice, gestures, and expression made it difficult for me to root for "the good guys."I would love to see Vosloo in some more films (not to mention Rachel Weizs (she has an absolutely captivating face!)

Review title: Better than the original, but special effects can't make up for poor acting.
Review_body: The Mummy was great special-effects-wise, but the kudos almost end there. Adding a little story to the original 1932 classic, it still was a joke in some parts.  Brandon Frasier and the rest of the actors cough up some particlarly pathetic one-liners, and there is a bit of slapstick also. The beginning is cool, but that's where the seriousness and style end.  The ending is typical.I gave it a 7.  Not bad if you're curious, but more believable characters and better dialogue would have been a plus.

Review title: A well told epic tale with horror, action, comedy and romance!
Review_body:
For those of us who enjoy a good adventure movie and a good laugh, but burrow down into our seats when a movie gets too 'gory', The Mummy was a pleasant surprise!  I was dragged along and expected to only see half the movie, but was quickly engrossed in this wonderfully epic tale and amazed at the special effects so much, that I thoroughly enjoyed the movie.The story tells a timeless tale woven around a beautiful country with a wonderfully rich history. Something to remember is that it is based around the mythology and beliefs of an ancient society, and you can't get better storylines than that.Of course the actors played their part, by portraying action, adventure, horror, comedy and romance beautifully.  John Hannah was great (as always), Brendan Fraser showed he can do action and adventure as well as the next man, Rachel Weisz was also very good as the beautiful heroine. 
BUT Arnold Vosloo and Oded Fehr, not taking anything away from other cast members these guys were fantastic. I have to agree with 'catmom2' I definitely would like to see more of both these actors.  Arnold Vosloo, where have you been? His portrayal of the Mummy was magnificent, who in all his evilness still looked vulnerable, I have to admit to feeling sorry for The Mummy.  Oded Fehr, well I'm sorry for falling into the superficiality trap, but his dark and brooding good looks were definitely put to good use.This is a movie that I would recommend to my friends, who enjoy a good story with enough action to keep you interested but not too much blood and guts, some great one-liners and comedy scenes that have you chuckling and of course the fluffy little romance story for those of us who think there's too little of it in the world today.

I had so much fun at this movie, not to mention the two people on each side of me were predicting every next move. Alright, it was a little predictable, and some parts were shocking. The only part that got me was her telling her life story when she was DRUNK! The comedy in the movie was keeping me laughing, and the horror was keeping me on the edge of my seat. I jumped a mile in the air when someone threw a piece of popcorn on me! If you're looking for a movie just of fun and kicks (maybe you might actually get scared!) go see this one.

Review title: Movie was too cute for me.
Review_body: I liked the look of the movie. The scenery and the costumes really made you feel as though you were in Egypt in the early 1900s. The movie, however, was "too cute" for me. I was expecting to be scared. Just when the characters should have been afraid for their lives, they said something comical. For this reason I was disappointed and only gave this movie a 5 out of 10. I agree with another viewer, ANDYO's, comments.

Review title: If you can't get into Star Wars, GO SEE THIS MOVIE!!!!
Review_body: The Mummy was a fun, exciting, and suspensful movie that completely entertained me from start to finish.  The FX were outstanding, and the actors had great chemistry together.  Star Wars may be better, but if you can't get into the showings of Star Wars and you still want a lot of bang for your buck, go see The Mummy.  You won't be disappointed.  Great movie!

The Mummy is most definetly one of the best movies I have ever seen. Good action, good effects, good sound, good acting, and good story. It has cool action and even some comedy. It entertained for the 2 hours in which the movie ran. I would advise you to not miss this one on the big screen and make sure you see it in DTS sound!!! All around great movie! **** out of ****

Review title: A solid film, but you may want to wait until the video.
Review_body: In 1926 Egypt, a spunky librarian/Egyptologist (Weisz) saves the life of an American Foreign Legionnaire (Fraser) who claims to have been to Hamunaptra--the ancient Egyptian City of the Dead. She is looking for the book of Amon Ra, but finds a 3,000 year old mummy who's having a really rotten day.Let me begin by saying that I'm really not fond of horror films. I generally stay away from movies that have the primary purpose of scaring the audience. So, what was I doing at THE MUMMY?That can be answered in two words: Brendan Fraser. I have enjoyed Fraser's performances in past films and find him to generally be a likable character. Unfortunately, he was miscast as the lead character of Rick O'Connell. In a role that called for cool-headed stoicism, he came across as stiff and befuddled. I believe his "Encino Man" and "George of the Jungle" characters have rubbed off on him. He was monosyllabic to the point of muteness.The script tried to give Fraser plenty of Arnold-esque throwaways to evoke laughter, but Fraser simply does not have Schwarzenegger's panache. Beyond a few mild chuckles, there wasn't much to evoke the campy feel that I believe the producers wanted. Fraser is affable, almost goofy, but he tried too hard to be hard-bitten when he should have accentuated his little-boy persona.There was a distinct "been-there-done-that" aura surrounding this entire production. The set-pieces and sequences were strictly by-the-book thriller/action cliches ripped from countless other like-minded films. We have flesh-eating scarab beetles, ancient spells, American treasure-hunters, British intellectuals, a groveling evil sidekick, mysterious desert tribesmen, and lots of skeletal undead shuffling about.I also found the effects and cinematography to be disappointing. I like to get a "movie" experience when paying for a theatre ticket, and THE MUMMY failed to deliver. Much of the film plays out in the claustrophobic labyrinth beneath Hamunaptra. While the lighting was always done well-enough to see the action, it would look much the same on a small screen as it did on the large. And the CGI mummy was stiff and mechanical. Especially in the full-body shots, it moved more like a stop-motion model than computer wizardry.There were a few good scenes. One set of warrior mummies move with the grace and speed of giant cats. An old warrior gets a final chance at redemption and brings a lump to your throat. And there's some pretty good sword fighting in the climactic scene. In general, the supporting cast was solid, with decent acting jobs all around.So, what did I really like about THE MUMMY?That can also be answered in two words: Rachel Weisz. As the inept librarian, Evelyn, she simply sparkled. She was a bright, effervescent light in a gray film. She added color and levity to every scene and bubbled over with more personality than most of the rest of the cast combined. Her naivete layered over a harder core makes her one of the more interesting heroines to appear on the silver screen in some time. THE MUMMY is definitely worth a look see for her appearance alone.But you may want to wait until the video is released.Cavebear's ranking for THE MUMMYQuality - 3: Solid, if unspectacular, film.Appeal - 2: Nothing new or exciting to offer fans or non-fans of the genre, but should play well until the Stars fall on May 19. Then it will be (un)dead in the water.Final ranking (Q+A): 5

Review title: A great adventure movie for the whole family!
Review_body: The Mummy offers a easy to follow plot with great characters.  This movie has it all from the laughable moments to the terrifying(for u kiddies) moments!  This movie isn't slow paced and does a very good job at keeping the movie in motion with unexpected events.  I am usually skeptical of a PG-13 movie's performance but this one did outstandingly well!
This is not just another replay of an old story. They did a very good job of building suspense. The special effects will knock your socks off. I smell a sequel in the making.

Review title: For the laughs and effects, but not chills
Review_body: If you go see "The Mummy" expecting to be scared out of your wits, you will be very disappointed.  "The Mummy" is not a scary, horrifying movie.And it doesn't intend to be.It's hard to take the antagionist Imothep seriously when every time he roars, his jaw grows as big as Jay Leno's.  Of course this movie doesn't intend to take itself seriously, as evidenced by the silly accident in the curator's library scene about 10-15 minutes into the movie.The acting was not above average, and there are loopholes in the plot you could drive a truck through, such as what are American cowboys doing in Africa in the 1920's?  However, the special effects were excellent, especially the sandstorm scene."The Mummy" probably won't be the worst thing you'll see this year.  It might even be entertaining.  All in all, it's not a bad movie to take in if you're looking for something to do on a lazy afternoon.Rating: 7

I was really disappointed with this movie because I had pretty high expectations. The trailer was pretty exciting, but it turned out that all the good stuff in this movie was in the trailer. The movie tried both to be spooky and funny but failed on both accounts. The mummy was stupid and the main characters were boring stereotypes, the female lead was especially annoying. The script is very bad and the direction is not good either. This movie is a huge backwards step from Sommers last movie, Deep Sea Rising which was much better.I did give this picture 2, because some of the special effects were quite good.

Review title: A review of a new take on the classic horror
Review_body: Back in 1932, The Mummy, starring Boris Karloff, had a quiet eeriness about it - it still does. I didn't know what to expect almost seventy years later when Universal released a modern update of the horror tale. With all the fuss over the latest computer generated imagery, I knew that it would either be another special effects laden summer blockbuster, or an exciting adventure in the tradition of Raiders of the Lost Ark. I suppose it was a bit of both, boasting some breathtaking effects in one of the best adventure films of recent years.After the opening Universal globe dissolves into a desert sun - think back to the beginning of Raiders and the Paramount logo - we are introduced to Imhotep, played by Arnold Vosloo, in Ancient Egypt. When he is found with the pharaoh's mistress, he is mummified alive and sealed inside a coffin with flesh-eating scarabs while the mistress kills herself in hope that he will resurrect her. Sound unpleasant? It's a way of getting the audience's attention from the very beginning - that's for sure. Then we cut to the 1920's where ex-American Legionnaire, Rick O'Connell, a dashing Brendan Fraser, is being chased away from The Hidden City of Hamunaptra by black robed guards. Librarian, Evelyn, played by Rachel Weisz, and her money-grubbing brother, Jonathan, played by John Hannah, free O'Connell from execution years later in hope that he will lead them to the city. And indeed off they go, only O'Connell suspecting underlying evil, with the opposing explorers, among them Kevin J. O'Connor and Jonathan Hyde, hot on their trail. Of course when they reach the city, the mummy is unleashed and in turn he sets out to bring his love back from the dead, destroy those who stole the Book of the Dead from his chest and generally cause a lot of havoc and mayhem.If all of this sounds a little silly, then you're right - it is. But it is the kind of light-hearted excitement a summer blockbuster should be. While the film doesn't offer too much in the way of character depth, Fraser comes across as a likeable hero, providing the brawn; Weisz is the respectable librarian-turned-adventurer, providing the brains; and Hannah plays the witty Englishman who provides most of the humour. Saying that, the humour doesn't always work and Fraser's over-the-top heroism is at times irritating. The art direction is worthy of mention, and when the director allows the camera to pull back over a scene, the film looks fantastic, perfectly recreating turn-of-the-century Egypt. Add to that Jerry Goldsmith's exotic and exciting score and you get the best period adventure in a long time. The Mummy isn't without fault, but with all the drivel Hollywood has produced over the last few summers, this is definitely worth a look.

I love this movie.  I've seen it two times in theater and now going to see it the third time.  Each time I see it, it seems better!I feel so sorry for Imhotep (the mummy).  Everyone is so mean to him!  And most of what happened was not his fault.  Everything he did was out of his love for Anck-Su-Namum!

Review title: Slightly related to the 1932 Karloff classic, but fun and flawed
Review_body: This go-around of the Mummy genre is flawed (when you find Imhotep the best character in the movie, it's flawed). However, it's fun in an Indiana Jones way.  The director needs to trim the film down to about 90 minutes and tighten up the story.  For example the flying scene with Bernard Fox is superfluous.  But for a Saturday matinee, it's OK.  Hope you didn't pay full price to see it.

The Mummy had some very good special effects and it was very loud which made me jump. but the storyline was not that spectacular and i didn't think that it was worth the money to go and see it. If you want my advice go and see it for the special effects but nothing else.

Review title: A good choice to spent your Saturday night.
Review_body: When I first heard about `The Mummy' I thought it would be one of Hollywood's overproduction movies that require a good cinema with Dolby surround sound, hi-tech projection machines and of course a big pack of pop-corn in order to enjoy the astounding special effects and the breathtaking actions scenes. Usually this kind of movies are depended on their Visual Effects because the screenplay is very poor. But when I saw the movie I realized that I was wrong. Mummy's story is depended on an ancient Egyptian legend about Hamunaptra `the city of the dead'. It is said that there, under the sand, it is buried for 30.000 years the ultimate evil, the mummy of an ancient priest who disobeyed the orders of the Pharaoh and fell in love with his wife. The movie has a fair screenplay with immediate responses that some times are really good and some times dead as dodo and boring. Brendan Frazer (you must remember his from `George of the jungle' or `God and Monsters') is playing his role quite good. However, the most powerful feature of the movie is the amazing scenes and the astounding Visual Effects (made by `Industrial Light & Magic': Star Wars Series). To sum up Mummy is a good choice to spend your Saturday night and watching it you may feel like watching an `Indiana Jones' movie. Rating: 5,9/10

This movie was hard for me to rate, because some of the lines were so cheesy, but they were cheesy enough to be funny.  I feel the same way about the acting.  Also, there were some of the best 3D animation I've seen yet. I gave it an 8 mostly because of the superb special effects.  And, I don't think they took themselves way too seriously.  I liked it enough to see the sequel.

Review title: I can't believe they let this out in theaters...
Review_body: This was the most pathetic attempt at a movie I have ever seen. It was TERRIBLE. When I voted, I wished I could give it a ZERO.  It was unworthy of even a one. It was a waste of an hour of my time and 6 bucks to see it... this was worse than Godzilla!

Review title: One of the most enjoyable movies ever
Review_body: I skipped this movie in the theatres because it did not look interesting. Was it a horror film? a comedy?  I really couldn't tell from the previews. Then it exploded in the theatres and it still didn't interest me.  Until one day i was walking through a movie store and i picked up the box.  I looked at it and bought it.  Imagine my surprise when it quickly became one of my favorite movies ever.  There are very few movies that were ever as much fun to sit through and watch.  I watched it three times the weekend i bought it and never got bored.  The special effects helped move the movie along, but the movie had a story and a plot.  In the tradition of Indiana Jones and Jerry Bruckheimer flicks, this action/adventure is definitely worth viewing. You want to have fun at home, this is one way.  Go out and buy it.

This would have to be one of the best movies of the summer of 1999. Sommers gives an sort of but not quite Indiana Jones adventure with a mummy. Perhaps the story and acting isnt great but thats not what summer movies are about...there about being entertained for an hour or 2 just like this movies does.Unlike the over hyped,over rated,and over blown Phantom Meance this is actually fun which Phantom Meance should have been. The special effects are awesome, Im suprised they werent nominated for an Oscar. Everyone invovled seems to have fun from Fraser to Sommers in making this adventure. A sequel may be interesting...who knows it may become Universials own Indiana Jones adventure series.Well in the end its a fun 2 hours that entertains from begining to end. Enjoy!**** out of *****

This movie was so bad that I don't even know why I am wasting my time reviewing it. I don't understand how these crappy movies even make it into the movie theaters. Whatever you see, don't rent this movie, its a waste of time and money! So far, from what I've seen of Brendon(or however you spell it) Fraser he's an awful actor! This movie gets a bomb from me. The special effects, acting, and plot is all stupid.

Review title: Hey, Beni! Looks to me like you're on the wrong side of the river.
Review_body: This is one of my favorite movies and I will always love it. I've rewatched this so many times, it's unreal. I love the plot and how the movie progresses. I love all the characters. There's humor, sarcastic lines, adventure, and action. There's some horror but not enough to scare you.

Review title: A brilliant parody of the action/horror genre
Review_body: Reading the most highly-rated comments for this film, I've seen many praising the action and the "fun-factor". But none have highlighted what for me takes this film to a higher level, which is the way that it adroitly and subtly sends up every mummy/horror/action film in the genre.It is a masterpiece: the progressing bullet-holes in the paddle-steamer's side, about to take Fraser's head off; the salute as the bi-plane sinks into the sand; the dismembered arm reaching for the sword at *just* the right moment. It is simply the most ingenious parody I have ever seen -- and it does it all with such grace that most viewers never even noticed.But for those who are aware of it, there are a few signposts to show that this parody is intentional. The one that stands out in my mind is the camp-fire that flickers every time someone mentions something otherworldly, until one of the characters remarks, "That happens a lot around here, doesn't it?"This film is comic timing at its best. Rachel Weisz, Brendan Fraser and John Hannah are clearly having a ball, and who can blame them? This film has it all -- action, comedy, great lines and a hot librarian.

This is my absolute favorite movie! I first watched it at a friends house last year. It was a few weeks ago I saw it again. It was a Friday night and my younger sister and I were flipping through the channels when I noticed the scene where Rick (Brendan Frasier) and Beni (Kevin J. O'Connor) are about to open fire on the approaching horsemen. I told her to hold on and explained what movie it was. Since then, I've seen it seven times on the same channel.My male cousin enjoyed it for the action (there's some form of a lethal weapon in nearly every scene!). My sister liked it for the comedy. I myself liked everything about it; ancient Egypt has always held my interest.It was a good movie. All the characters seemed to be given to the appropriate people.Just one thing: why did Beni say, "Nice camel," when he himself was riding one? It doesn't make the show any worse, but that didn't make sense. I guess it's because they wanted Beni to fall off the camel, and I doubt Rick could've reached him if he was riding a horse. (should've cut the comment then, huh?)Over all, it was great, and I don't see why so many people were complaining about the jokes. Lighten up a bit, people!

One of the best movies ever made with Ancient Egypt theme. Being a huge huge fan, still before I can even remember how small I was ,of Ancient world of Egypt and not only, it's still one of big passions and this movie was like a big gift.
Have always loved it as a child and still do. Miss the times.
21 years have passed. Feel like crying. This is a diamond.
The cast and everything is perfect.
Love!

I love this movie! It is funny, but not ridiculuous. It is amusing and exciting. The colours are fantastic and the action is breath-taking. I've seen it five times in the cinema. The actors are excellent, they really identify with their characters. What I really hate, is "The Mummy Returns". It is just ridiculuous and nothing else. And I'm not alone. Everybody who has seen "The Mummy" and liked it, despises the second part. You have to watch "The Mummy" a few times to discover all the gags and hidden elements. And it's worth seeing them. So, just try it.

I will never forget the first time I went to see this movie in the theaters.It was such a memorable time. The film kept me hooked from the start with its humour and soundtrack. It was filled with suspence and chilling moments.Until today I have seen it more than thousand times and I will continue to see it until I die because it's a masterpiece and it takes me straight to Ancient Egypt.This is the best adventure film of all times that deserves a 10 out of 10 rating.

This remains, even after 5 years, solidly at the top of my "worst films ever" list. It is simply the absolute worst film I have ever seen. If it was meant to be irritatingly laughable then it is extremely successful, but if so it still isn't up my street. The money went, quite clearly, on special effects. That is, a calamitous jumble of humorous 'spirits' and the likes. I.e. pure garbage.The remaining 1% of the budget probably (if they were lucky) went on the cast and the script writer. This had the best collection of the nation's (I really mean planet's) worst actors/actresses. They were painfully bad and if I'm being honest, it's probably this that distracts you from the 99% that was spent on the effects. Maybe that is a slight alleviation for Sommers from delivering the worst film of all time, but he's pushing it.The dialect and script is so bad you feel embarrassed for the cast that they have to further relinquish their barely existent reputations by nearly enacting them.Now that I have slated this awful, awful movie, I will advise anyone who hasn't seen it never to even pick up the box and read it. The fact that this was so popular (admittedly among kids) is unlikely to be beaten as the biggest mystery on the face of the earth

Review title: best action flick of 1999, still a challenge
Review_body: Of general opinion, Matrix was THE movie to watch in the final months of millennium gone. And yes, both sequels sucked. Matrix 2-3 were high-budget, but non-democratic flicks. mummy 2 sucked too, but we will - in this review - not care about that - its the money honey. the first part will have its way to a real classic - why? it did not bother with a love story (wich, as we all know, is not the reason to watch this particular movie) but 1tries to entertain quite ALL OF THE TIME. Doing so without the philosophical bullshit Matrix tortures us with, what more can one expect? this is cinema as it was to be meant. And if you don't want to live with the red pill, this flick will make the time worth worthwhile.

So before I begin this rather short review I will say this, don't watch this movie with Indiana Jones in mind as it has been compared in the past...its just simply not its a "Fun" adventure in EgyptThe Mummy is based around an American serving in the French Foreign Legion on a dig in the ancient city of Hamunaptra.Personally for me this is the best out of the trilogy of movies. There is a good deal of action and some rather good comedy mixed in with it. Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz and John Hannah make this movie as entertaining as it is, they just work well together on screen.Overall its a great action/adventure that you could watch over and over again.

Review title: If you are searching for a negative review, then move on. Not going to find it here!
Review_body: It's Saturday night during the corona pandemic and you feel nostalgic? Then the Mummy is the perfect movie for you. I have never met someone who dislikes this film. Some may find it silly, somme outdated, but it has that quality that captures you no matter how many times you have rewatched it. Personnally, I think that it is a great example of its genre, it is funny and the chemistry between the two protagonists is one of a kind! Hands-down 10/10! Please make a remake with Brendan Fraser and Rachel Weisz!

Review title: pretty good movie, not great but good
Review_body: I thought this movie was okay. It was very action packed which adds to the movie a lot.I thought that the second movie was better, well the reason being since my brother watches the mummy like 5 times a day it kind of got annoying but at least I got it by memory now.Its just basically about a high priest called imhotep who kisses a woman thats supposed to be untouchable but when the pharoah finds out of what he did imhotep kills him and ends up getting the penalty of death himself.He comes back to life and to resurrect his girlfriend (so says Benny)and wreak havoc.

This movie was very fast paced and exciting.  It keeps you on the edge of your seat.  It even made me jump and I don't jump during movies.  The graphics were excellent!  You think that the mummies might actually be real. I suggest that you run out and watch this movie and then buy it on video.

Review title: An indiana Jones movie a little worse
Review_body: An Indiana-Jones movie a little worse. It wants to have the same feeling of a good adventure movie but sometime is a little stupid. The charachter of the girl's brother is quite unuseful. After these bad comments I have to say that the movie is not so bad: It is nice to see but it should (I expected to be) a lot better.

Review title: A blend of a bunch of good movies.....
Review_body: Brendan Frasier's brief journey into high art started and ending with "Gods and Monsters" -- he returns to earth with "The Mummy" but on a higher level than George of the Jungle.  This is a good blend of "Army of Darkness" meets "Indiana Jones" meets "Clash of the Titans" meets "The Keep" meets "Stargate" -- it ain't art but it's fun.And it ain't for young kids......

Review title: Heh. Indiana Jones meets slapstick and camp. You gotta love it.
Review_body: The Mummy? If you only saw the previews for it, you'd think it was a SPFX-filled horror flick. If you go to see it, your perceptions will be adjusted to see that it's a SPFX-filled campy comedy-type filled flick *tinged* with horror. Think: Indiana Jones meets, oh, not quite the 3 Stooges, but close. It basically brings back the feeling of the campy Saturday afternoon "horror" flicks - with a lot more humor. Admittedly, some of the scenes were downright creepy - flesh-devouring beetles (that you never really see doing such, it's only 99% implied), ghouls crawling rapidly after the good guys - down the sides of the walls, that sort of thing. But this film is so peppered with 1-liners, staged comedic spills and the like, it's very difficult to take as a pure horror flick - or to stop your lips from splitting open in a hearty belly laugh. Brendan Fraser parodies Indiana Jones wonderfully - with more humor, smugness, and dare I say it, giggly attempts at romance. People might slam his performance, but I'd say it's as solid as Keanu "Huh?" Reeves in "The Matrix" (is that a bad thing to say here? I don't think so.) Rachel Weisz puts on a great performance as the slightly-off-kilter knowledgeable Egyptologist, and has a handful of priceless 1-liners and slapstick scenes in points...and Arnold Vosloo... well...for a pretty minimalist acting job, I thought his screen charisma and presence stood out pretty strongly. I'd second other people's thoughts here in that he looked a lot like Billy Zane in "The Phantom". He did! Able supporting cast, creepy opportunist-turned-darkside's-evil-henchman played aptly by Kevin O'Connor...great scenery, wonderfully designed sets...and did I mention the SPFX yet??? :) It all ends predictably enough, but it's an enjoyable ride - and one that will bring more laughs to your face than you expect. Dunno if it's worth buying on DVD, but plunk down your $X and see this movie - it's a nice piece of lighter fare which could balance out your diet of serious, grimmer stuff (Matrix) or larger-than-life wanna-be legends (Star Wars Ep. 1)...etc. Check it out.

I saw 'The Mummy' on opening day, and it is a pretty cool movie. The beginning is pretty interesting, and Brendan Frasier's character provides the action. The movie was very humorous and in a way, pretty scary. I think they should have called this something like 'The Mummy's Curse', since The Mummy Imhotep curses people with crickets, sandstorms, scarab beetles, skeletons and quicksand. I say go see this movie!

Review title: Skeptical at first, satisfied at end!
Review_body: Excellent movie!  I was skeptical at first, unsure of the casting choices for both the hero, and the heroine.  By the end of the movie however, I found that both actors had done a fine job.  The movie could have had a little more character development as far as the hero is concerned, but hey, what can you really expect from an action/adventure/horror movie? Overall, I thought the movie was excellent, and well worth the price of admission.

Review title: Fraser Good, Special effects good, movie bad
Review_body: You'd think if you had a great cast, amazing effects and a good plot, you couldn't go wrong...but you can!  The comedy was very dry and a complete failure.  Not one line made me chuckle.  The romance was completely non-existent.  There were hundreds of plot holes, unexplained phenomenon, and completely unbelievable feats.  Things like camels beating horses in a race.  The acting was very impressive considering the dialogue was horrible. Most of the movie, even the beginning was very predictable.  You sat through it knowing what was going to happen, and waiting out the supposedly "humorous parts"  just to see the special effects.  Which didn't make up for the rest of the movie unfortunately

Of course it's a bad rip of Indiana Jones, but the effects were fun to watch and its basically entertaining.  As far as the effects they were very cool, but the Mummy itself wasn't very good, looked more like a robot than a person when it was moving.  It reminded me of the exo-skeleton in Terminator.

Review title: Really good story, good acting and great special effects.
Review_body: Great set-up at the start of the movie and keeps you glued to your seat. Brandon Frasier does a great job in the role of the adventurer, without appearing as just an Indiana Jones rip-off. The cast has good chemistry, the script moves smoothly and the action never stops. The creature is scary and interesting and very unpredictable. Excellent movie, great for most all of the family members.

Review title: Formula: (Congo x Army of Darkness) + Raiders of the Lost Ark - Good writing
Review_body:
You take the first rate production values (and lame script) of "Congo;" mix in the undead, book of the dead that is accidentally used to release the villain, & the goofy protagonist of "Army of Darkness" and have everyone convince themselves they're doing the next Indiana Jones movie. Half bake for 2 hours and you've got "The Mummy." This movie is to Raiders what ID4 was Star Wars:  Lame junk that may vaguely remind you of a classic while making a mint based solely on top notch special effects.What's good about the movie:  Likable cast and great CGI.  Set Design is top drawer as well. Also if you have kids it will scare them without traumatizing them for life.  Most of the grisly action takes place off screen or in silhouette.What's not so good:  Brendan Fraser plays his usual goofy guy that people loved in "George of the Jungle."  He also (like Chris O'Donnell in "In Love and War") cannot play a non-contemporary character. This fact is really another caveat (however unintentional) to Bruce Campbell's hero in "Army of Darkness.  Fraser is not alone in his plight however, as every American character in the supporting cast would be hard to believe as a person from 1975 let alone 1925. Luckily they are all so non-descript and are killed off so quickly you'll have to think hard to remember any of them.The action scenes are done like a video game.  Fraser runs around with two guns that hold impossibly large quantities of bullets shooting everything that moves.  These types of scenes are really exciting when done with style like John Woo, however, that never happens in this movie.  The hand to hand combat also reminded me of playing Double Dragon on my old Nintendo system. The moment where you actually suspend your disbelief and worry that the hero won't succeed never occurs.
The supporting cast is mostly unremarkable.  Rachel Weisz (the poor man's Helena Bonham Carter) is quite beautiful but so are the Rocky Mountains and she lacks their depth.  It's not really fair to put her down that way, let's just say she's equal to the material she has to work with.Kevin J. O'Conner just does an ethnic version of the same character he played in writer/director Stepehn Sommers' last opus "Deep Rising." (I suppose he is Toshiro Mifune to Sommers' Kurosawa.) Granted Mr. O'Connor is reprising a role from a movie no one saw and he plays it well so I guess he could actually qualify as a highlight. He certainly is trotted out whenever they need comic relief.  As a bonus to fans of "Bewitched" Dr. Bombay also makes an appearance as a WW1 bi-plane pilot.In the final analysis, this certainly isn't a bad film...just dopey. Remove the digital effects and it's a Roger Corman movie.  Unlike the effects heavy Matrix there is not a single innovative idea to be enjoyed.  This movie will linger with you about as long as it takes you to digest your popcorn into what the script was from the beginning.

If it wasn't for some eye-popping special effects, I would have walked out! It wasn't exciting or funny. The script was childish and the acting terrible.What is it about filmmakers these days that makes them feel like they don't need to have a good script if the effects are cool!  Save us from Hollywood, George Lucas!

Considering that this was a story probably written with  a younger Harrison Ford in mind, Brendan Fraser was fantastic filling those shoes as Rick O'Connell.  I felt that Fraser was able to portray O'Connell with the quick thinking and fighting ability of Ford's Indiana Jones and with the attitude of Ford's Han Solo.  I'm not saying that Brendan Fraser is our next Harrison Ford, but we could do worse.  Fraser was great.The movie itself was well made and kept me interested.  My wife would not go so I had to take a friend with me (the bugs would have really bothered her). I very good series of action scenes and a lot of suspense.  On a scale of 1 to 10, I gave it an 8, but it was almost a nine.  And I am picky!Go see it if you like action or even action with a sense of the melodramatic and romance.  Worth the investment.Jay

Review title: Indiana Jones meets Army Of Darkness
Review_body: It´s Indiana Jones meets Army Of Darkness with a bit of Errol Flynn adventure, some interesting supporting characters and state of the art special effects thrown in. Nothing new in particular, but a unique mix. One of the films that is not trying too hard to be anything more than just good entertainment, but being one of the best at that. Highly recommended.

Review title: This movie was awful. Although it started out fai...
Review_body: This movie was awful.  Although it started out fairly strong I could still tell that it had gone through several rewrites.  Meaning the dialogue was stupid.  Not only that it didn't make sense.  I don't mean to be to obvious, but it reminded me of another production about Egypt that depended solely on special effects and had no real story to speak off, Stargate.The Mummy tried very hard to be Indiana Jones, and unfortunately Brendan Frasier is not as strong an actor as Harrison Ford.  The female lead was very strongly played both for intelligence, vulnerability, and tremendous sex appeal.  However her talents were largely wasted here.  All in all this turkey was for the most part unwatchable, and save for the incredible special affects the money spent on this movie could have fed starving people in Brazil.  Trust me, the world could have done without The Mummy.  A tip for the failing Universal Corporation:  Stop making bad movies.

This movie is pure escapist entertainment.  It's a movie you can take your kids to and everyone can have a great time. Good performances, great special effects, great Goldsmith soundtrack, and lots of exciting action and romance. I think if you are looking for a fun time at the movies, go and see this one.

Review title: Awesome movie! In the same vein as Indiana Jones.
Review_body: "The Mummy" for myself, was an instant classic.  It had everything: action, romance, comedy and some stunning Special effects.  I was amazed at how the film was so potent and adventurous.  It had some obvious influences (ie. Raiders of the Lost Ark,  old adventure serials, etc.) but I think they created something new here.It has some queasy sequences that might turn off a few viewers, but it is done in such a fun way that you hardly notice, like the "Indiana Jones" series.  It is not quite as good as the Indy pictures but it is something to tide us over until Indiana Jones 4.  For fans of adventure and comedy alike see "The Mummy"!

Review title: enjoyable, great effects, Frasier proves himself as an action/adventure type
Review_body: I enjoyed this film despite the lack of solid dialogue and (at times) schlocky storyline. Although Frasier's role in the film is not immediately apparent, he dives right into a character that resembles a young Indiana Jones and pulls it off nicely. The most of the computer generated effects were very good, but no animation house has mastered human character animation so the early movements of the mummy Imhotep are awkward and unconvincing. I give it a nine on a ten point scale. Mostly attributed to Frasier's contribution.

okok...I know it wasn't a monumental film or anything like that.  And as anyone can point out, it's a near blatant rip off of the Indiana Jones genre.  But hey, there's action, adventure, excellent special effects, blazing guns, fire balls, monsters, swords, magic, curses....it was fun! If you want deep and meaningful, watch Schindler's List.  If you want casual entertainment, this will more than suffice.
Dumb, Stupid and Dumb.........The only genre that this movie falls into is the one with Independence Day, Armageddon, Deep Impact and all the Die Hard movies.Did I mention dumb! :)

Review title: I say, jolly good show, chaps
Review_body: Where to begin?  I had heard mixed things regarding The Mummy, but i must say that it met and even surpassed all of my expectations.  It feels just like a Saturday matinee, with great action, great comedy, and great thrills. The most important thing to keep in mind for this film is that it is not meant to be any single one genre, but rather a very effective mix of these genres.The elements of horror are perhaps better described as thrills, as The Mummy tends to rely on a few "things that pop out" scares. This helps create a sort of background tension that crops up throughout the first half of the film, in spite of the rather goofy humour.  The action sequences are well-done as well, adding to the conglomeration of genres represented. The overall effect is a movie that spreads itself perhaps just a trifle thin, but still provides an excellent amount of fun and adventure.

Review title: Excellent special effects, but weak script and acting.
Review_body: I can recommend thE latest version of "The Mummy" as a Saturday afternoon diversion that will entertain most horror movie fans and pre-teens. I had a good time and really enjoyed some of the special effects, in particular, the sword fights between the Brenden Frasier character and the reanimated subordinate mummies. However, some of the campy dialogue made me cringe, and I felt that many of the punch lines fell flat with the audience. Some of the acting was second rate, although I enjoyed Frasier in the lead. So for some cool images on a weekend afternoon this is fine, but don't expect much else.
If you like Indiana Jones than you will enjoy The Mummy. It was scary, had lots of adventure, and was very funny! :) For a fun , summer flick; go watch The Mummy !!!
Brendan Fraser shows again his ability to bring enjoyment to the movie going experience!  A very nice mix af adventure, humor, and special effects!  A summer MUST SEE!

Review title: a basic special effects movie, yet highly entertaining.
Review_body: At first sight, this movie seems like yet another special-effects blockbuster based on an old story a la Independence Day or Godzilla, but unlike those, it seems to make up for it's uncreative ideas with pure edge of your seat thrills.  It features way too many john woo-esque gunfights (which is a very good thing) and periodic spurts of humor (the moment where brendan fraser holds up the cat for Im-Ho-Tep comes to mind), which separates it from other CG effects guidebooks. Although it may not have the legacy of The Phantom Menace or the intricate storyline of the Matrix, the Mummy was still enjoyable

The special effects were great, however it's hard to see them with your eyes rolled in the back of your head -- because of the super-cheesy lines and sight gags.  The comedy that was injected into this movie really just did not fit for me.

Review title: If you want to have fun at the movies, see this one...
Review_body: The Mummy was a fun movie to watch.  It didn't have an elaborate plot, and it wasn't a high quality "thinker" or anything.  But I go to the movies to have fun, and this was an entertaining movie.  Good F/X...good humor...just a good time.  It won't be up for any Oscars, but I usually don't like those movies anyways.

Review title: Indiana Jones it ain't but it's still fun
Review_body: I went and saw this movie on it's opening weekend twice. First with three other adults and they completely enjoyed it. The second time I took my three kids plus a neighbor, (ages 6, 14, 15,15) and they ate up this film like a big bag of cotton candy. Is it great film making? NO. Is it as good as Karloff? NO. Is it fun and entertaining? YES. That's why this film will bring in over 100 million this summer. See it and enjoy it for what it is, a 1999 movie thats draws from the monster movies of the 50's and adventure movies of the 80's. It's not rocket science...it's a movie that delivers laughs, thrills and a few chills.

Review title: Great film. Left feeling completely entertained. Great summer film!!
Review_body: The Mummy was a great film. Granted, it was not the original, but it was still thoroughly entertaining. It had elements that inspired a variety of reactions. It had its thrilling moments, amusing moments. The special effects were excellent, some of the things they did were absolutely stunning. The sets were really lavishly done. The monuments and locations portrayed looked extremely authentic. While there were a couple of graphic scenes, the humour was placed in just such a way to break any frightening scenes for children or younger viewers. Went to it not expecting much, but I left feeling far more satisfied than I had intended. Highly recommended.

This was a movie I really enjoyed!  It made me both laugh & jump a bit out of my seat.  To me, it was kind of a mix of Indiana Jones & Army of Darkness. In other words, great action that didn't take itself too seriously.My husband and his friend "dragged" me along to see THE MUMMY last night, and I wasn't really expecting to like it; the previews and commercials looked like the effects were a bit hokey.  Put into context, however, the hokeyness really worked for the storyline.If you are looking for a highly entertaining film, I would strongly recommend this one!

Review title: A light-hearted update with all-due respect to the original.
Review_body: As a fan of the original Universal horror films, I dreaded the idea of a big-budget production replete with CGI; however, I was pleasantly surprised by this remake of 1932's "The Mummy".The story takes the original idea (old not-dead guy wants old dead high school sweetheart back) and gives it a 90's scarier-than-then tweak. Imhotep, a bad-ass Egyptian priest gets fresh with Pharoah's woman, and as punishment receives the worst death/curse in the books.  Unfortunately, as with most curses, if you find that book, he comes back.  And like most catch-22's, he's a booger to kill.Fortunately, like Richard Chamberlain's Allan Quartermain films, this action-filled horror film is sprinkled with good-natured humor which intrudes only once, fortunately at the beginning.  Gunplay is superb, as long as you dig good old-fashioned multi-six-shooter gunfights.  And historically the film does a good job, and very little of the fictionalized Egyptian culture is questionable.What surprised me most about the film is the special effects. The CGI as said before is the best I've seen in a long time, and only falters when more than one beetle is on screen and when .22 caliber machine gun shells make manhole-sized pocks in the face of a sandstorm.  The worst effect regrettably seems to be a favorite, as Imhotep's distended jaw lets loose too many supernatural howls.  The film lags only when the romance seeps in and breaks formula a little too much in those rare places when formula works.  The denoument does seem rushed, as the curses suddenly go on hiatus after arriving in previously rapid succession.  The ending was reasonably anti-climactic, but natural, and combined with the overall good-natured feel of the film, I was reminded of the best sci-fi film in years: "The Frighteners", and as is rare in Hollywood, the two films could be from the same universe.In short: A respectful update; a peanut butter and jelly cast; clean, but abundant special effects; good and plenty action & humor; fluid story & presentation; worth full price admission.

Review title: If you see ANY movies this summer, DON'T see The Mummy
Review_body: This is one of the worst movies I've seen, and I've seen a lot.  The premise is not bad, and the effects are actually quite good, but neither could save this film from the abysmal acting and god-awful script.I won't waste time describing the story, as you can find plenty of such descriptions.  I will simply note that it has a considerable number of holes.  It had potential, but fell far short.Stephen Sommers, who most recently brought us the inane Deep Rising, has made that film look like a masterpiece in comparison to The Mummy. As the writer/director, he deserves the most blame for this catastrophe, regardless of box office receipts.  Perhaps Sommers should get some writing advice from Tarantino if he wants to be witty, or at least competent.This film attempted to rely on the popular one-liner, but Brendan Fraser was not the man to pull it off.  "Clever" he is not.  I've seen this film compared to the Indiana Jones films, Big Trouble in Little China, and other great adventure films.  However, Fraser cannot live up to the stars of these great movies.  He did not have the timing to carry the lines.  However, I cannot place all the blame of Fraser as he had a miserable script to deal with.I don't know how anyone could possibly enjoy the banter between the characters and the off-timing one-liners which Fraser dispenses far too frequently and with far too little ability.  I was painfully reminded of Mr. Freeze in Batman and Robin, to give you an idea of how bad it truly is.The film reminded me of "Army of Darkness" in many ways, but without the skill and flair Sam Raimi and Bruce Campbell brought to that film.  The creature effects were quite similar, with the initial mummy creature looking something like the "evil Ash."  Also, the attempts at humor and witty one-liners were similar as well.  However, you'd be much better off watching "Army of Darkness," for it is by far the superior movie.  As for comparisons with the Indiana Jones films, I will not even dignify them with a response.The Mummy is not worth your time or money.  I would suggest going to see this movie ONLY if you are so into effects that you can overlook the plot, script, acting, and all other aspects of the film.  The effects are truly the only redeeming quality, and even they really aren't anything new. Save your money.  I wish I had.

Review title: If you're in search of a comedy of thrills, keep searching.
Review_body: Falling somewhere between a weak comedy and an unsuspenseful thriller, the Mummy fails to deliver anything but around 120 minutes of sheer boredom.Two words: dry and disappointing. Fear or gore won't redeem this poorly crafted picture (remember the PG-13). The only laughs are unintentional and weak. The few mildly intriguing characters are under-developed and the protangonists are insultingly stereotypical. If you see this movie you will find the phrase "what an idiot!" repeatedly finding its way to the tip of your tongue.The film begins with an obvious computer simulation of the cartoonish egypt from "the Prince of Egypt."  The characters in this animated film are more believable than the comic-book style ones in the mummy.Once we are brought into the 20th century the movie falls apart. (about 6.5 min into the film)  The characters motivation is hokey and the props look like bad halloween costumes. I will spare you from going into great detail. And don't want to ruin anything for those half-wits who still plan to see it.If you are between the ages of 5 and 9, or dim adult you may enjoy this film. The story line is simply and predictable.  The good guys are attractive and the bad guys wear black.

I was truly entertained, knowing nothing about the movie except the trailers in the theater.  The special effects were wonderful --- from the Mummy to the beetles and everything else.  What I enjoyed most was the humor, the movie was not "scary" or "horrible".  It was very much in the style of 'Indiana Jones', amusing, tongue-in-cheek without being offensively camp.
This is the move that keeps you on edge and waiting for the next exciting thing to make you jump in anticipation of next thing to happen. I recommend this to all who like suspense and excitement.

I didn't like any piece of this movie that wasn't added by computers. Seriously, the acting was bad, the plot was corny and overall I found myself laughing at some of the supposedly serious moments. The special effects were fantastic, though!  I mean, I won't tell you what they involve, but they are amazing!  I was absolutely amazed by some of the things they did.  Special effects usually can do two things: add to the story (Forrest Gump), subtract from the story.  In this movie, however, they are the story.  There is no other reason to watch this movie, in my mind. The only neat part of the movie that wasn't a special effect was in the last scene of the movie, something sparkles, adding a nice little smile to the end of the movie.  Other than that, I think my dog could have written this movie.

Being a fan of the original "Mummy", and anything associated with ancient Egypt, this was a movie I had to experience; and quite an experience it was. After leaving the theater, I had the same exhilarating sensation as when I saw "Raiders"...oh so many years ago, and that is the main point of this film.....to let the audience member have fun and be entertained. And, by the way, the special effects are not to be missed......go to the next showing of this film!

I wanted to be entertained for 90 min, and I was. It had humor, great effects, and somewhat of a story. Arnold Vosloo is fantastic as The Mummy. And how can you hate Brendan Fraser, he's very versatile. No, It wasn't as good as the Indy movies, but then I wasn't expecting it to be. Maybe that's why I got a kick out of it. Unless you're someone who always has to analyze a movie to death, you'll enjoy it. Oh, and keep an eye on the actor, Oded Fehr, (he played the Bedouin who helps Rick). I think we'll be seeing more of him around also.

This movie was not scary, nor was it funny, for Gods sake it wasn't even entertaining.  I wasted two hours watching one of the worst movies I have ever seen in my life.I approach movies two different ways.  One is two be entertained and enlightened, the second is to be only entertained.  For this movie I chose the latter.I was not entertained.To try and excuse a movies poor acting, plot, and story by saying we should watch movies to be entertained and nothing more, is weak.  How deaf do I have to be to miss hearing overused cliches.  How stupid do I have to be to excuse ideas stolen from: Star Wars, Indiana Jones, and the Ten Commandments. And how blind do I have to be to miss poor special effects. Be assured people, the special effects were no better than in Raiders of the lost Ark.  However, millions of dollars weren't spent making that Nazis face melt.Why are the Yanks in this picture Cowboys?  Were Americans still taming the Wild West in 1920's.  Perhaps the vast open plains of the good ol' U.S. weren't satisfying enough.  Hey, if I think hard I seem to recall an old Saturday Morning Classic "Roy Rogers and the Nile."The gags in this movie were old, the jokes tired.  I laughed more at the people in the theatre who thought this junk was funny.Is there a formula machine in Hollywood that creates garbage like this. If so I have a wonerful tale about a benevolent Flower Pot salesman who travels back in time to steal Jesse James gun in an attempt to stop the first daylight bank robbery, that I'd like to give a try in such a machine.The only thing that stopped me from walking out were the two fat women sitting on the ends of the aisle blocking my path.When it comes down it people will be entertained by things they enjoy. But just because I see my cat pawing at the T.V. screen doesn't mean it's a good thing. This movie is not a good thing.This is crap, plain and simple.

Review title: Special effects do not a film make.
Review_body: Now this film isn't dreadful by any means. It has a (moderately) reasonable and nicely old fashioned plot with occasional witticisms. The villain is nasty, the special effects are good and the actors are, well, OK.Unfortunately it also has several flaws. It has a large number of references to films that it has essentially copied (mainly Indiana Jones but really the whole Spielberg canon) without improving or satrizing them. The whole of the "shock" factor comes from extensive views of the undead with little thought to actual tension. The hero isn't very heroic; the heroine not worth saving.And I'm not convinced it isn't another in a long line of stereotyping-Arabs-as-untrustworthy-savages films that have come out of America in recent years.I'd watch the Hammer Horror film any day !

Review title: A Good Movie, and It's About a Stupid Mummy!
Review_body: I went and saw this movie because I heard it was really good, so I went and expected to see a piece of trash, but the movie was great!  It had some of the best special effects I've ever seen and the acting wasn't bad either.
The Mummy wasn't what I expected. It was funny way beyond my expectations. This was not a serious movie. It was fun.

The Mummy is a big box-office hit and it will be too in Holland, but is it a good movie? Say about the first 45 minutes are so bad, that they qualify to be ranked in the worst movies ever list. But when Brendan Fraser and crew unleash the mummy, action begins and you'll get a sort of an Indy Jones feeling. Then the movie turns to a action-pic with horror-effects. And then the movie really begins to be exciting. The end with a lot of mummies is actually really funny and good. So it is an exciting last hour but the movie is certainly not special and so isn't Brendan Fraser or the rest of the crew; the only one with a really good part is the South-African that plays the Mummy. He is really good. But I give The Mummy not more and none less than a 6. For comments: r_jvw@hotmail.com. Thank you.

This new Universal mummy movie is much better than I expected going in. Taking the basic premise from the classic 1932 horror film starring Boris Karloff as Imhotep, this '90's version plays more like a fourth "Indiana Jones" flick. Brendan Fraser is surprisingly likeable in the role of Rick O'Connell, adventurer. Rachel Weisz, WOW! She is a great leading lady, funny, sexy, smart and down to earth. Arnold Vosloo is a great villain as the scourge of Egypt, the undead Imhotep. The adventure is exciting and balanced with a lot of humor. A must-see for fans of rip-roaring adventure flicks.

I really enjoyed this film;It was brilliant and quite funny.I found it really jumpy and scary in places.It was better than I expected.The film had no bad points. I recommend you go see it. My rating is 9/10.

Review title: Thank God the theater was air conditioned!
Review_body: This has to be the worst piece of crap I've ever seen on the screen.  It couldn't decide if it wanted to be comedy or horror, and it didn't matter. When it tried to be funny, I found myself laughing not at the jokes but at the script-writing.  And when it was trying to be scary, it was more about special effects and gross-out factor than anything scary.I'm just glad that the air conditioning was working so well since it was so hot outside.  That was worth the $3.50 I paid to get into the theatre. Too bad it had to be spent watching this awful waste of film.

The creators of this "remake" of the Karloff vehicle stated that they wanted a "mummy for the 90's".  Well, that's exactly what they got.  A flashy film where the title character is an ACTION FIGURE.  Ready made for the toy market. I must be old fashioned, but I much prefer the dark mystery of the older films.  The only good thing about this rash of remakes (IMHO...Imho-Tep!) is that they focus attention on the originals.  If the "new" Mummy hadn't been made we might not have the"old" Mummy on DVD.  Same goes for The Avengers movie.  Thanks to that fiasco I now have a complete collection of the released Diana Rigg episodes on the little discs.  So maybe I shouldn't complain!

Review title: Saturday mornings when you were 12 yrs old
Review_body: "Rescue the girl, kill the bad guy, save the world" and that's what they do - it's a good indication of the level of the dialogue as well.  Which is an over the top boys own ripping yarn and knows it and plays up to it.  Load up with junk food and beer and friends and switch off your brain.

Review title: Short and concise appreciation for this film.
Review_body: I loved this flick. It was funny, scary and sexy without being stupid, wretching or sleezy. The special effects worked for the movie, the acting was professional. I will watch it again and will not hesitate to refer it to anyone who loves a "scary" movie that comes across without negative and excessive blood & guts. Additional plusses: No nudity or foul language.

The Mummy was a good action movie that left you wanting more...and less. Yes, it was a fun movie. Yes, the action was good. Yes, the special effects were cool. But, it borrowed too heavily from other movies and you've seen the same plot before. There is absolutely nothing original about this movie. It borrows, okay, steals from Indiana Jones, Stargate, Jason and the Argonauts, etc. Yes, the plot is completely predicable. You know who is going to live and die at the end of the movie after 30 minutes. But! It is a hell of a ride and is very enjoyable for what it is. If you just want to sit back and be entertained for a while you will totally enjoy this movie. I recommend it but don't expect anything new.

cant get any better than this. with at least 3 hot males in the movie and a wonderfully silly but, fiesty herione who could ask for anything more. even imhoteps' mummies were funny, squealing when shot, hacked or slashed made it for all around good fun. takes a person back to the serials that went with movies from the early days of motion pictures. the cliff hangers every week. the only thing better will be "the mummy returns"!!!

This movie was one of the best of 1999. Brendan Fraser did a great job with his humorous little tid bits and acting. This is one that you can never get sick of. All the actors did a great job. It is a great mixture of Action,Adventure,Romance,Comedy and Horror. It also has true information about Ancient Egypt in it. This movie was great and I recommend it to everyone!

This tongue-in-cheek 'horror' doesn't have a lot going for it.  It is badly acted, poorly written and has laughable special effects that reminded me of an early Doctor Who production.  It really is not worth watching.

Dont get me wrong. I do like this film but whether I would want to watch it again is another matter. It was ok but nowhere near as good as it was made out to be. Its not funny, scary and to be honest, really that interesting. Yes there is adventure but the over acting makes me cringe. See it once and enjoy. But don't watch it again.

It is really big fun.  The tricks are first class. I don´t care about the wrong history. If I want to see true history, I watch national geographic. It is really excellent entertainment. And Imhotep is very sexy.

Well, once again Hollywood brags about how big and powerful computers they have. Nice effects, but as long as they make movies for the effects and not effects for the movies, well I'm a bit bored. It didn't make me through up like ID4, but came close. What a pure plot! God damn it Hollywood, haven't you got anything better to do with your computers?

This movie is one of the best that I've ever seen. Director Stephen Sommers did a fantastic job at making you feel like you were really in Egypt during 1926. Brendan Fraser and Rachel Weisz make the film come alive with great acting and tons of chills.
This is my all time favorite movie this is my childhood movie

As campy as this movie is, that's what makes it great.  This movie doesn't take itself seriously, but it also keeps some sense of plot and so on without becoming just a dumb gross-out comedy.  And while it does exceptionally well as a comedy, it's essentially an action/horror movie, which it also does very well.  This movie was great, and if you liked this movie even one bit, see the sequel too.

The mummy (1999) is the return of the Egyptian terror theme renewed and updated to the 90's.The story is good, compelling and exciting like an Indiana Jones movie while having some fun and humor into it.The egyptian theme has been thoroughly researched by director Stephen Sommers: -the name Imhotep is truely egyptian (not invented) as it relates to the famous Imhotep, architect of thee stepped pyramid of Saqqara.-Secondly, the egyptian reading and speaking are also correct. -the statues of Horus and Anubis correspond to the egyptian style (not like in Stargate where the eye of horus symbol is displayed but named "eye of ra")The actors are excellent with a slight "British humor" style which is definitely refreshing in an American movie.Finally the special effects are mind-blowing with a superb opening shot in the ancient city of Thebes. The digital mummies are also greatly rendered by ILM.Whatever aspects of this movie you prefer (action, humor, story, SFX) you'll definitely love it.A true gem 10/10.

Review title: Modern-day Raiders of the Lost Ark
Review_body: This movie is fun, action packed and keeps you on the edge of your seat.  I see it as the modern-day Raiders of the Lost Ark.  Great movie that even the kids can see.  Brenden Fraser shows a new side - other than the completely silly roles he usually plays and he plays this new type brilliantly!

Review title: i loved the movie because its funny, scary, and lots of good looking men!!
Review_body: This movie is one of my favorites (along with its sequel) because it is a fun movie that everyone can enjoy. (Not to mention all the good looking men) (I wish there was more of Oded Fehr Ardeth Bey) Brendan Frazier and Rachel Weiss are a perfect pair. They set each other off and bring out the best and worst of each other. U cant help but love them. Jonathon is an excellent comic relief as well as Beni. Arnold Vosloo as Imohtep is awesome. These men have perfect bodies!!!!!!I would recommend this movie 2 everyone!!! My children and nephews love it, too (they r ages 5-13)... action, drama, fantasy, horror, comedy... What more can u ask 4 in a movie???!!!

The mummy is one of the best mummy films. I don't know why people like the 1932 mummy i think they don't know what they are talking about. I watched the 1932 mummy and i fought it was crap it was so cheesy. In the 1999 mummy it has the best special effects best music great acting and the feel of egypt. The mummy is my all time favourites thanks to stephen summers who directed it and ILM( Industrial light And Magic) the special effects people. This movie is well directed , well scripted, and well acted. I thank the people that did this film because i love it. borrow this film watch it and buy it you'll love it.....

Review title: The sands will rise. The heavens will part. The power will be unleashed
Review_body: The Mummy is the best mummy movie ever to be made. This movie will blow your mind by its action, romance, adventure and music score. I loved The Mummy because it's one of those roller coaster rides were you just jump on and never let go. The Mummy is a remake of the 1932 mummy which starred Boris Karloff who played imhotep. The Mummy is about an expedition of treasure seeking explorers in the Sahara desert in 1925. They stumble upon an ancient tomb, the hunters without knowing set loose a 3,000 year-old inheritance of terror, which is personified in the vengeful reincarnation of an Egyptian priest who had been sentenced to an infinity as one of the living dead. I love watching this movie in 1999 at the big screen. This movie made me love Egypt a lot. I guarantee this movie a classic. Do not compare this with the 1932 movie.  Thanks to director Stephen Sommers which he did a wonderful job on this fantastic film. If you want to see this movie do not watch the 1932 one watch the 1999 one because it will blow you away. Last things to wrap this up Spectacular special effects, Roller coaster adventure, Funny moments, Out of the world music score, Superb acting and wonderful cast. This movie is a 10/10 stars.

I think that this movie is awesome! It is an action movie of epic proportions and not to mention a huge romance movie! this move has stuff for the action lovers and the romance lovers! It will make guys cry and girls scream "go kick some major mummy butt!"! Overall this movie KICKS THE CRAP OUT OF ALL THE OTHERS!

Probably one of my favorite movies to watch, The Mummy has a Indiana Jones feel to it with more comedy to lighten the mood. Director Stephen Sommers did a wonderful job in the tone of the movie, making it serious enough to maintain interest but humorous enough to remind the watcher that anyone taking a mummy movie seriously has some serious issues. This is entertainment in pure form.

This is one of my favourite movies, I rewatched it so many times and each time I enjoyed it. I loved the actors, the story, the costumes, the sceneries. I became fascinated with ancient Egypt after I saw this movie and Rachel Weisz became my favourite actress. I wish they never made that horrible movie with Tom Cruise it's not even close as good as this one.

The Plot: A librarian and her brother save a prisoner from an untimely death by recruiting him to help locate a fabled Egyptian tomb, and set off into the desert to find not only treasure, but a labyrinthine burial ground for a cursed Mummy who, in the course of the adventure, "accidentally" becomes resurrected and wreaks havoc on everyone with a fez, dress or gun. The Pros: More than anything this film is very funny, especially if you pay attention to the witticisms in between the main dialog. Then there's the entertaining and very well done special effects (watch for the scenes with the mummy-induced sand-storms; pretty amazing stuff). The slapstick doesn't make for a very good horror film, but it does still manage to get it's "grossness-quotient" in with flesh eating beetles and soul-sucking rotting corpses (great effects again done to make the Mummy appear, well - "juicy", as they say in the movie). The acting is as good as it's going to get for a film of this genre, which in my opinion outshines even the Indiana Jones trilogy. Brendan Fraser is just plain perfect - delivering one uproarious line after the other - much more entertaining than Harrison Ford IMHO. Special nod to Rachel Weisz for being unexpectedly funny for what could have been a typical damsel-in-distress role. Check the memorable quotes section for sample dialog - good stuff!The Cons: The Mummy Returns does not satisfy, Tomb of the Dragon Emperor (The Mummy 3) is even worse, and the Scorpion King, which stole it's plot from The Mummy Returns, is worse than drinking bleach. On an empty stomach. Great Scenes: Omid Djalili as Warden Gad Hassan who, about 45 minutes into the film, runs into the scene screaming and hands clasped atop his fez as beetles devour him alive. I've replayed this scene at least 20 times, and each time it just gets funnier and funnier.
