I can´t understand why so many people dislike Brendan Fraser - I think he´s funny (and also quite good-looking =) ) ... This is an entertaining movie - I sure did get good laughs =)  And I´ve seen this several times.Just wanted to say HEY - he´s NOT that bad they say ! Not at all!!

I will have to say that "Mummy" was an action adventure film in the spirit of "Raiders of the Lost Ark". I know there have been other attempts over the years, but "The Mummy" comes the closest to hitting the mark."The Mummy", directed by Stephen Sommers, is the story of librarian and aspiring archaeologist Evelyn (Rachel Wiesz), accompanied by her brother Jonathan (John Hannah), enlisting the help of French Foreign Legion soldier Rick O'Connell (Brendan Fraser) to find a lost Egyptian city. I prefer not to say more as this type of plot is best when the story unfolds before you.Sommers directing is fast paced. There is never a dull moment, never a talky interlude to break the tone of the action. Every scene in the film is necessary for the plot advancement. Director Sommers knows an inherent part of any action film is to keep the camera moving. There are very few "static shots".The special effects, by ILM, are fantastic. I was hooked from the opening sweeping shot of a bustling city in ancient Eygpt, beautifully recreated.Brendan Fraser is a very credible action hero. As Rick O'Connell, he has such a clumsy, boyish charm you can't help but like him. With a half smile and his perchant for the understatement ("You brought a new friend back from the desert, didn't you Beni?"), he is almost the equal of Harrison Ford's Indiana Jones. Rachel Weisz is wonderful as the aspiring archaeologist Evelyn and John Hannah is fun as her near do well missionary brother Jonathan. Kevin J. O'Conner as scared of his own shadow Beni (I won't reveal what his role is in the story) is delightful.What keeps this film from being the equal of "Raiders of the Lost Ark" is the lack of character curve. Unlike Indiana Jones, who learned the hard way to respect powers he can't touch or see, I can't think of anything any of the characters in "The Mummy" learned.However, "The Mummy" is still rip-roaring entertainment. Sommers and Executive Producer Kevin Jarre (screenwriter, "Glory") wisely created a film with an emphasis on action. They must have figured (rightly so) that any story about the Mummy presented to 1999 audiences would just not be scary, so the tone was changed to action/adventure.Action films greatly rely on the ability to make the audience believe that what they see is possible within the first five to ten minutes. If this doesn't happen, the viewer will have a poor experience for the rest of the film. Most action films cannot achieve this. They "shoot their bolt" too early, rendering the rest of the film unbelievable. Also, the closer an action film is to related reality, the more difficult this becomes. Like "Raiders of the Lost Ark" (still my all time favorite action film), "The Mummy" allowed me to suspend my disbelief within the first ten minutes.

Review title: The Mummy is a great movie, enough said.
Review_body: The Mummy may not seem like a movie worthy of a 7/10 rating but that's only because viewers don't take the time to look at the movie with an open mind. The Mummy was an action movie that involved not only comedy but also a sense of adventure. This movie deserves more applause than it originally received. The Mummy didn't necessarily have the best plot or even the greatest acting, but a movie cannot be judged on those two characteristics alone. A movie should be judged on what you take away from it. What I took away from this movie was that it was funny, exciting, and original. That is enough in my opinion to qualify The Mummy as a great movie. Even if you've seen the movie once or twice try to watch it again and see what you take away from the movie, then judge it as you see fit.

This movie is living proof a fun action packed movie with silly FX can stand the trial of time. I think this movie mixes perfectly lots of genres, suspense, thriller, some horror, lots of action, some romance and comedy. I don't think any other movie does as brilliantly as The Mummy does.And all the characters are likeable, even the villains. Rick is the tough guy with a soft heart, Evelyn the brains of the operation, Jonathan the funny guy, Imhotep the baddie who only wants his girlfriend back. Some people complain about historic inaccuracies, well... if you want to have an ancient egyptian masterclass, go to the History Channel, this movie's purpose is to entertain, not educate.It's still perfect for a Sunday afternoon with all the family (well, not little kids, it may be a bit too much for them).

Possibly the first time I saw her was on TV when I was little and I loved it. The plot is entertaining and charismatic characters . When awake Imhotep really scared me , or when the pharaoh is killed by example . I do not think those scenes are very friendly, but make the more mature film to be a product that is recommended for over 7 years. At least in my country that is the age to see this movie.The best scene in the movie is when Imhotep steals eyes to Burns. Although still I feel a bit false because they do not bleed the least.A curious fact is that Ank at the beginning of the film is completely naked I go by the Arapo and paintings .

Review title: One of the best films of all times!
Review_body: Adventure, myth, horror, romance, hollywood production, great cast and british humor! What can be better?

Review title: The Mummy franchise relaunch by Universal.
Review_body: I like it when the Universal relaunched the franchise "The Mummy" is a 1999 American action fantasy film which was written and directed by Stephen Sommers and starring Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, and Kevin J. O'Connor, with Arnold Vosloo in the titular role as the reanimated mummy. It is a loose remake of the 1932 film The Mummy, which starred Boris Karloff in the titular role. The film follows adventurer Rick O'Connell, who travels to Hamunaptra, the city of the dead, with an archaelogist and her brother. There they accidentally awaken Imhotep, a high priest from the reign of the pharaoh Seti I, who has been cursed for eternity.Filming began in Marrakech, Morocco, on May 4, 1998, and lasted seventeen weeks; the crew had to endure dehydration, sandstorms, and snakes while filming in the Sahara. The visual effects were provided by Industrial Light & Magic, who blended film and computer-generated imagery to create the titular Mummy. Jerry Goldsmith provided the orchestral score.The Mummy opened on May 7, 1999, and grossed $43 million in 3,210 theaters during its opening weekend in the United States; a surprise hit, the film went on to gross $416 million worldwide. The box-office success led to a 2001 sequel, The Mummy Returns, as well as The Mummy: The Animated Series, and the prequel/spin-off film The Scorpion King. Seven years later, the third installment, The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor, opened on August 1, 2008. Universal Pictures also opened a roller coaster, Revenge of the Mummy, in 2004. Novelizations of the film and its sequels were written by Max Allan Collins.

This 1999 movie stays faithful to the source material of 1932, and 1959's remake of the same title. The actors with Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, and many others did a good job in this movie. The scarab bugs are very instant and very scary to the audiences, The scarab bugs that could eat the flesh of whatever creature they could catch, particularly humans.The movie has lots of awesome action, suspenseful moments, such as flying an airplane and getting chases by the Mummy sandstorm, the final battle scene with the Mummy. It stays true to the Egyptian culture, and the recreation of late 1920's Eqypt is well done. The story is pretty well written and it didn't take a lot of elements from other movie companies, and this written story does its own Indiana Jones inspiration, but it has different styles throughout the entire movie. It was a huge success, and it had an movie inspired Universal Studios theme park attraction called Revenge of the Mummy in Orlando and Hollywood Florida, and even in Singapore.Overrall, it's fun, and it great!Hope you like my review! :)All rights goes to Hasbro, and Universal Pictures.
Just purely simple and fun. It has action, basic romance, comedy, not much horror but contains a decent atmosphere of adventure and thriller.

Intelligence?  Originality?  Plot?  Who needs it when you've got a film gleefully making fun of itself and enough F/X to make you enjoy the ride? If you are looking for brain candy (and don't mind a few cavities), this is a fun movie (particularly if you are a fan of MST3K.  Opportunities to mock abound).

This movie is a solid 5 on the IMDB.  It is pretty standard Hollywood fare, as you can probably tell what is coming before it happens for most of the movie, but nevertheless it is entertaining.  The special effects are good, and though parts are quite cheesy and/or campy, it wasn't a bad film.  In fact, this is probably the first "special effects movies" that I didn't think was outright horrible.The action hero, a beautiful female archaeologist, and her thieving brother go to the ancient city of Hamunaptra and accidentally awaken the Mummy, which will of course destroy the world if they don't stop it.  The major plot lines are the budding romance of the hero and the archaeologist, the competition between these people and a group of American diggers who are also trying to pillage Hamunaptra, and the betrayal of the hero's former side-kick.  The back and forth of the side kick and hero almost reminded me of Snake Plisskin and "Brain" in "Escape from New York."A little beer and a few friends would make this a good rental.

If you're looking for 2 hours of fun, this is a good choice.  There's nothing exceptionally good about this film, but it does hold your attention and interest.  The Mummy, Imhotep, is not really an evil character in the tradition of monster movies.  He was a good guy in the beginning (1200 B.C.), but cursed for cheating with the Pharaoh's mistress.  Now he comes back looking to revive her.

Review title: Brendan Fraser, the new Indiana Jones. Soon.
Review_body: A promising entry in the action adventure genre, attempting to follow in Indiana Jones' footsteps. Still a bit rough around the edges, with a bit of practice, we may truly enjoy another collaboration between director Stephen Sommers and ever developing actor Brendan Fraser. Congratulations as well as an Oscar nomination is well deserved for versatile cinematographer Adrian Biddle (Aliens). This is an easily enjoyable film.

Review title: It was filled with beautiful people.
Review_body: The movie was fun, the plot was cool, but the people were so dreamy.  The woman who plays the mummy's love interest was clad in only a few black lines.  She was very desirable.  The young gentleman who played the protector of the city of the dead, beautiful tattoos and all, was well worth the 7.50 I paid to see the movie.  And that Imhotep wasn't bad either! I would see the movie again for the comedy, the adventure, and the sexy actors.

Review title: Excellent effects, but not the movie I wanted
Review_body: They advertised The Mummy as a straight out adventure/horror movie with Brendan Fraser and his friends taking on the ancient Egyptian creature, and that was the movie I wanted to see. Unfortunately, what I did see was a movie with a decent plot and actors dragged down by awful one liners and corniness.  It's hard to be scared by a monster when the actors in the movie don't even seem intimidated by it. If you want a serious take on the legend of the Mummy, this isn't for you, but if you don't mind a comedy adventure movie (like Congo) that tries but doesn't come close to being an Indiana Jones film you'll probably be entertained by The Mummy.

Review title: Effects are good. Acting is good. Everything else is just awful.
Review_body: This is a perfect example of what Roger Ebert calls the "idiot plot," where the events of the story are driven largely by the fact that the characters behave like morons. The direction is uninspired, and the dialogue is often so banal it makes your teeth hurt. "Hey, nice camel" is the epitome of this movie's wit.

The Mummy. A remake of the 1932 Boris Karloff classic. Times have changed. Nearly all of the scenes in this film are enhanced with astonishing computer graphics. Whole scenes are just computer generated - and this was well done. It's hard to say if it's real or if it's just an imagination from a high speeded 'calculator'. The movie itself has a good story, based on the original. Some 'treasure-hunters' (some are lookign for gold, others for the 'Golden Book of Amun-Ra') found a lost city. They enter it and find the 'Book of the Dead'. During reading it, they awake the mummy of 'Imhotep' - a high priest who was burried alive, because of his evil living. The war between small 'earth# powers and the inmortral mummy begins. A surprise for everyone was, that they put lots of jokes in the movie, so you also have to laugh a lot. Over all the movie was excellent. The technices used, the story and even the actors. My Tip: This is a film to see, and even if it's over 120 minutes - it's never boring...

Review title: I thought this was the funniest film i had seen in ages!
Review_body: I'll be the first to admit i have a twisted sense of humor.  I'll also be the first to tell you that if you look at the Mummy critically you won't be able to stop yourself from rolling out of your chair crying from laughter. the plot is so cheesy and the dialogue even funnier, this movies is a combination of MST3K funny and dazzling special effects.

This is an excellent film. I expected a silly Indiana Jones-ish flick, but was surprised to find that it was much more. It kept my attention the entire time, and I never lost interest. It's adventurous and quite funny-- wonderfully entertaining! I loved that it was scary, too-- I hadn't expected it to be. It kept me on the edge of my seat, afraid something was going to jump out at me. I would definitely recommend this film to just about anyone. The special effects are amazing, too!  :)   go   see it!!
Definitely worth the price of a matinee ticket.  Fraser is as good as he can be, and the movie is only about 10 minutes too long.  Lots of action and good special effects except for a few scenes.

Admit it. The Mummy is one of the most derivative,predictable, and unoriginal movies around. It uses every old plot device and cliche from a hundred adventure movies, and stuffs them into two hours of special effects...but does it REALLY well. It's a lot of fun to watch, as long as you can get past that simple fact. There really isn't anything in this movie we haven't seen before, but we've probably never seen it done quite this well.It's very much in the spirit of the Indiana Jones movies (heck, Brendan Fraser really just plays Indy in a different job...and without a hat). I admire Brendan Fraser as an actor, and his performance is definitely one of the best things about The Mummy. The effects were nice too, but personally, I don't think digital effects have gotten to the point where you can make a fully CG character that doesn't look at least a little bit like a cartoon, so the effects didn't impress me all that much. Call me jaded. Besides, effects aren't the reason I go to see a movie. I want to be told an entertaining story. And The Mummy delivers on that point, for the most part.Overall, The Mummy is nothing new or particularly remarkable, but it's a pretty good way to spend an afternoon. It's entertaining, but nothing to write home about.

The Mummy was an ok 2 hr entertainment, but fell short of my expectations. I am pretty sure that there are a few people out there that know the must-see movies "Army of Darkness" and "From Dusk till Dawn". These two movies seem to have been the only inspiration for the last third of "The Mummy". sorry, but the end is so much like "Army of Darkness" ...

The Mummy has everything you need for an enjoyable movie-going experience. Take Indiana Jones and add some From Dusk Til Dawn and you have The Mummy.The special effects are very well done.  Sometimes it is hard to tell what is CG and what is real.One thing that really stuck out was the lack of foul language in the film. It is nice to see a film that doesn't rely on four-letter words.If you want to see something other than Star Wars see this movie!

Fabulous visual effects!  That's the last nice thing I'll say about this film. From our first view of Evelyn (how original -- a clumsy, yet intelligent woman who is completely powerless), I realized that I had once again been tricked into paying full price for a shallow concept. It was the same gutted feeling I had when I saw the evil black vans in Twister. They obviously had to make hard decisions on where to spend the budget. The script was sacrificed for special effects and the acting was sacrificed for pretty faces. Don't give these people any more money, I implore you!

The movie is fantastic There is some one for everyone to drool over in the movie and a lot of bodies to kill for (you will get the joke if you see the movie). The lines make you LOL or if like me giggle through out the movie The special effects are worthy of their Star Wars makers. Hope you enjoy it too.

Review title: Beats the hell out of old mummy movies
Review_body: Silly, but with a serious mummy and his pals.  Plagues, human sacrifices, sand storms, treasure, curses, a beautiful girl and an army of the undead.  I loved it.  Great sets.  Great effects.Mummies galore.What are you expecting, Shakespeare?

Review title: Enough special effects, humor, and action to make it worth seeing.
Review_body: The special effects for the Mummy, himself were fantastic. No hanging bandages on this villain just rotting flesh.  The backdrop locations were spectacular and really added to the scope of the film.The actors did an above average job with Brendan Fraser as the perfect balance of invincible hero and vulnerable human.  Rachel Weisz was excellent with enough intelligence and character to make her would-be clique role as the female lead and damsel in distress believable and likeable.The plot does tend to drag on and in the final scene one does get the hint that the special effects department was dying to throw in one more cool effect, but on the whole this film is more then worth-seeing.

Yes, maybe the dialogue in THE MUMMY sometimes is simple and cheesy. Yes, maybe we've seen it all before. Yes, maybe there is more action than story going on. Yes, maybe the movie looks like someone took an arcade game to the big screen. Yes, maybe it feels like a comic book came to live. Yes, maybe there are some things that are historical not really correct (like they are using books instead of papyros scrolls in Ancient Egypt, but then again the books are made of metal). Just let me tell you something: It's fun anyway!!! There was actually a critic complaining about the bad guys in this kind of movie always being bald. Well, dear Mr. critic, maybe that's because the priests in Ancient Egypt used to shave their heads. So, loosen up! Have a good time! Feast your eyes on the marvellous special effects! Laugh and cheer! And if you want to see high art and clever dialogue, go and see HAMLET for the fifth time. There people talk to skulls. At least the mummy DOES talks back - and more!
great great great great special effects & spectacular scenery.  i don't really know why but i just love this movie!

Review title: Great special effects meet terrible tongue-in-cheek humor.
Review_body: This is a typical summer movie.  The action is fantastic, the effects are super, and the characters are pretty flimsy.  The humor gets really annoying.  Who would crack jokes when being confronted with a mummy?  In all, a fun adventure that should please action junkies.

Review title: Delicious men, beautiful woman, flesh-eating bugs, and living dead. I'm so digging it.
Review_body: What a terrific, fun, Friday night movie.If it had been intended as serious horror they would have pushed it to an 'R' rating, but going into it at PG-13 you've got to expect a little bit of camp.  It's a real kick. Brandon Fraser is at his absolute yummiest, and Evie is perfectly lovely. Andrew Vosloo as Imhotep is a powerful, commanding screen presence--and the bare, muscular chest doesn't hurt things, either.Go see it. Have fun.

If you liked any or all of the Indiana Jones movies you'll like The Mummy. And no more scary than any of the IJ films.  They could have gone for the blood and gore a lot and steered well clear of it.  Lotta fun.

The MUMMY is like Francis Ford Coppola's DRACULA, in that it is driven by a love story that spans 3 millennia! Its setting, pace, look & sense of humor are right out of the Indiana Jones playbook! Its special FX are fantastic! The story is fast-paced! Go see it!

Review title: Good effects, fun characters, quite entertaining, never a slow moment
Review_body: This is a pretty good action/adventure film, the special effects were very impressive for the most part, although, nothing totally new, multiple bugs, sand storms, walking skeletons etc.  Brendan Fraser does a convincing job as the hero of the film, he's good looking, brave, ready for anything, but the guy is NOT the next Harrison Ford, though he does try. The most impressive part with respect to the main characters is that this movie is not a Brendan-fest.  The film spends enough time on ALL the main characters, and they all get developed past the point of being scenery. They even get to help fight the bad guy! Imagine! The plot of the movie moves right along, you get a brief background on the mummy, straight and to the point, you meet the main characters, and you're off.  No time wasted, which is just the kind of treat to have in this sort of movie.  If you go to the movies for entertainment, you will enjoy this, and have some laughs, if you go for enlightenment, give it up.  It's fun, it doesn't try to be a carbon copy of an Indiana Jones movie and even brings in a couple of surprises that you don't see coming. Girls who are looking for Brendan at his best will be a little let down this time around, he's not nearly as pumped and cut as he was for George of the Jungle, and we don't see as much of him exposed, but what can you do?

Review title: The Mummy is amazing CG coupled with good flow of action
Review_body: This movie quite possibly has the best special effects I've ever seen. Although the plot starts out just a bit slow, soon the action gets rolling and provides for a movie which I could actually sit through for over two hours. The action sequences are plentiful, well directed, and exciting, though their effectiveness is slightly clouded by noticable anachronisms (I noticed several guns in the movie which did not exist in 1923). I was also surprised to see, after his numerous comedy movies, Brendan Fraser work very well as an action hero.

Review title: Goofy remake of classic complete with overblown special effects
Review_body: The Mummy tries to combine Indiana Jones with the the original Mummy and only Brendan Fraser seems to understand that it's a spoof.

Review title: What a waste of two hours...
Review_body: This movie is just a shame. Nothing about it is even remotely entertaining. It's not scary, and it's not even campy enough to be funny in an Anaconda-esque way. The writing and directing are fit for a straight-to-video flick, yet for some reason millions of dollars were fed to this loser. Somehow, even the expensive sets, costumes and ILM computer effects seem low-rent. So what killed this flick? Maybe it's the characters, one of whom knows how to read heiroglyphics, studies ancient Egyptian cities, memorizes mummy's curses, but has never heard of Pharoah Seti I. Or maybe it's that the initial Egyptian set looks more animated than the ones in Prince of Egypt. Maybe it's that the mummy looks different in every shot, as they switch from dummy mummy to computer effect without checking for similarities. Maybe it's the idiotic bald-dude villain you see ten times more than the mummy. Maybe it's the fact that this bald guy roars like a lion. Maybe it's that no one ever looks like they've been told "hey, there's a scary computer mummy dude in this shot, so look frightened." Maybe it's the "army of the undead" at the end, who gain and lose weight at random (depending on whether they're obvious guys in suits or obvious digital effects), lurch around like decomposing Jerry's kids and are far less visually effective than the skeletons from Army of Darkness, which cost less than half as much. Maybe it's that I could count down precisely to every predictable, tired "jump-scene." Maybe it's the THREE "funny-drunk" scenes. Whatever it is, I'm very sorry I wasted two hours on this movie. Forget everything you've heard about this being a Raiders of the Lost Ark clone. There's no way the two movies share even the tiniest bit of DNA.

This movie was a good movie.  Worth the price of admission.  But, I think the writers and director didn't know whether to make a comedy or a horror/action.  Some of the scenes leave you wondering if you should be scared or laughing.  I think they needed to pick one or the other.

It was a good movie.  The beginning did sort of drag a little but without it you would be very lost.  Now, this movie reminded me of watching Indiana Jones and I don't know about you but I love to watch Indiana Jones.  Some of it did drag I will admit but all in all it was a great thing to see.  I don't think that everyone would enjoy it.  Some of the scenes are a bit much, but if you can use special effects why don't you use them.  I thought that it was a great movie and I do encourage anyway  if you like to watch a bit of action with a touch of romance to go watch this movie.  It just depends what kind of person you are I guess.

Review title: Great entertainment. Good combination of humor and horror.
Review_body: Loved the movie.  Well worth seeing.  Just pure enjoyment.

Interesting and creative special effects compliment a fun and action packed story. Very reminiscent of the old movie serials and pulp fiction stories of the 30's and 40's. And not a bad addition to the "Mummy" movie genre!

Review title: Get in the Car, and Go SEE This Movie!
Review_body: If you love a good plot, acting, effects, horror, adventure and humor this is the flick to see.  It also has great lines, set designs, costumes, scenery, action and fighting sequences.  It has Egyptians, Bedouins/Tauregs, American cowboys, French Foreign Legion soldiers, archaeologists, secret 3000 year old societies, you name it. Great characters. (If you're a chick note that nearly all of the good guys are fine as well as talented, and that the female lead is is a very strong character.)

Review title: A fun old fashioned adventure movie
Review_body: This movie was just a lot of fun to watch. To me it had a similarity to the old serials that I used to see at Saturday matinees at a theater in my hometown when I was a kid. There was a lot of cliffhanger moments and the pace of the action was very frantic, especially in the second hour of the film.  The plot is pretty basic and has been done before in other mummy movies, but what distinguishes this film is the wonderful special effects and photography. Industrial Light and Magic did a great job with the computer graphic effects. The thousands of beetles, called scarabs, are particularly frightening as thousands of them devour a body in just a few seconds.The heroine, Rachel Weisz, is very nice to look at and is very appealing. Brendan Fraser does a great job and has a lot of funny one liners in the film. Arnold Vosloo makes a great mummy and has a very ominous appearance. He is perfect in his part.All the sets and props are wonderful and show where part of the 80 million dollar budget was spent.The desert photography was very beautiful, and the effect of the desert sandstorm flowing over the cliffs was particularly impressive.So if you are looking for a fun exciting way to spend two hours, and if you like old fashioned adventure movies, your time will be well spent

Even while going in with no high expectations, I felt this movie was an opportunity lost. It could have been the next 'Raiders of the Lost Ark'. However, in my opinion, the script is cliched with cheesy one-liners and the plot appears quite arbitrary. One redeeming quality: special effects.

I saw this film last night (5/4/99) at an advanced screening.  I went into the film completely blind as to the plot, etc...I was very surprised to see an action/adventure/comedy film with very good special effects and a feeling not unlike, "Raiders of the Lost Ark".  All the characters were very personable, including the "bad guys".  I throughly enjoyed the film and will/have told nearly everyone I know that they should see it if they are in the mood for a very enjoyable time at their local movie theater. Everyone in attendance last night seemed to really enjoy the movie.  I would see it again and being in a business where I see so many movies and have little time to view something a second time,  that is high praise!

Well-written, engaging, hilarious, terrifying, beautiful - all those are words which do *not* describe this movie. At times I was screaming at the screen in anger. A high-budget film where the special effects portion of the budget could have been better used to buy some writers and actors.

Review title: Great Special effects, and lots of action and suspense a really good thriller
Review_body: The Mummy was a really good film. I liked the suspense and the thrill it gave me throughout the whole film. Brendan Fraser was great as the adventurous explorer.  The film is a definite must see for all viewers except the younger ones.  I still don't know if it could live up to the new Stars Wars movie?.

Action packed and good to the last drop, "The Mummy" for 1999 was a thrill-ride full of action, special effects, horror, and yes...comedy.  If you liked the Indiana Jones adventures, you're going to LOVE "The Mummy"Brendan Fraser did well as his role of Rick O'Connell.  Cocky though brave, he made the perfect "hero" of the storyRachel Weisz portrayed a headstrong and very knowledgeable (even if a little clumsy) Evelyn.  She doesn't take herself too seriously, though knows what she wants and just how to get it.John Hannah..FUNNY to the bone.  From his sudden (and funny) entrance to the end, he  provides humor and charm to the film.  Delivering lines with the same effect as Harrison Ford in the Indiana Jones films, he kept me smiling. Playing Evelyn's older brother, Jonathan, Hannah gave me my only LOL moment of the film, a little over an hour into the movie.  I'm not known for more than a few smiles while watching a movie, but Hannah's comedic touch almost brought tears to my eyes when he goes out to get the car ready for the others and is confronted by some nasty looking villagers.  Trust me....Brilliant.A 2-hour tour of beautiful scenery and tons of scenes that make you cringe, laugh, gasp, and sit at the edge of your movie theatre seat, "The Mummy" is worth the price of admission.

I've seen my friends play more entertaining games of Castlevania.  This movie had such a promising premise that it is a crime someone let this be made in such a way.  And all this talk of special effects is absurd.  I felt like I was watching a video game, and all though video games are becoming more and more real life, they are nothing compared to what a movie should be. This movie was bad.

Awesome special effects, Great Curse. Good Story Line, Pretty good acting, although too much humor in the wrong places.  I enjoyed this movie a lot. Loved the outfit of the Egyptian Princess, Anna-something:)

Review title: Definitely NOT what I was expecting.
Review_body: I was pleased to find so much humor in this film.  yes, the special effects were impressive, but they were not strictly necessary to hold my attention. Brendan Fraser, and indeed, the entire cast, did an admirable job with the action sequences. I'm not sure what I went into the theater expecting, but what I got was much more of a boon!  Go See It!

This movie is out of this world! It has great special effects and keeps you on the edge of your seat. The setting and costumes in "The Mummy" are fabulous! If you want to see an outstanding movie, please go see the movie! It's awesome!

Review title: A lot of fun for the whole family.
Review_body: I am seldom able to take my wife, 13 year old daughter, and 6 year old son to a movie that we all truly enjoyed. This movie is a two hour roller coaster adventure ride of a film.  Yea, you've seen it all before, but "damn" they keep making it better.  It's not cheap to take the whole family to a movie, but this time I can happily say I got my moneys worth.

When I took my son to see this film, I certainly never expected to find it so enjoyable!  Interspersed with the action were great special effects, wonderful moments of tongue-in-cheek humor, and plenty of things that go bump in the dark.  To top it all off, the characters were cast SUPERBLY. Viewing this film was a completely enjoyable experience.  I can't wait to add it our video library!

This was a wonderful movie with amazing special effects. This movie had a great cast of Brendon Fraser, Stephen Dunham, John Hannah, and Jonathan Hyde. A great director (Stephen Sommers) can really be seen. An exciting plot that leaves you at the edge of your seat throughout the whole movie. The old scary story of a curse of the temples of Egypt keeps you interested and informed of what the story is about. I give it two thumbs up.

This movie was nothing like I expected it to be. Indiana Jones it ain't.There are a lot of special effects in this movie. There's bugs that eat you alive, there's skeletons that fight, there's fires aboard ships and there's sand storms that are alive. The best special effect, though, is that everyone running around in the hot deserts of Egypt fighting for their lives DO NOT SWEAT! Nope, not one bead!Save your money and save your time. See something else.

Review title: A fun roller-coaster ride, but mildly unfulfilling and lacking depth.
Review_body: An exciting series of action sequences, but with stereo-type cardboard characters that lack depth and sufficient backstory. The effects, while beautiful are too extreme to be believed and lack the majesty and feeling of history of the real Egypt.There are so many good legends, curses and settings in real Egyptology that the computer generated ones used in this film are disappointing. After a while you are just waiting for them to say "Oh no ! A million computer generated bugs are after us again !"The Indiana Jones films had the same problems and mixed in some actual history and a logical set of threats.This film has booby traps that nobody but an idiot would set off (of course one predictably does just that) and illogical things like mummies that crawl out of the earth where there is no reason to believe they would have been buried.  Also except for the main Mummy the Egyptian priests didn't intend to get loose, those lame boody traps and some killer bugs, there is no real guardians of the terribly overdone mega-treasure. I would have expected it to be looted away to nothing eons ago.

Review title: Good, but a "rip off of style"
Review_body: The film industry is running dry when it comes to style, technique, and stories.  "The Mummy" is a good film.  I personally found it quite entertaining (I'd say 7 out of 10 stars).  But I'm not making a comment on how entertaining the film was.The director, Stephen Sommers, borrowed the style for the film.  The Mummy starts out very original but as the film progresses it suddenly developed a mood, look, and feel that reminded me of something.  When I thought about it I realized what it was.  The script and directing style slowly turned into the same as Sam Raimi (Evil Dead I, Evil Dead II, and Army of Darkness).Suddenly the film shifts tracks from an intense horror film where you are on the end of your seat, waiting to get scared and fall in or out of you seat; to a horror film with slap sticky zombie mummies loosing limbs and doing Three Stooges style humor (Ala Evil Dead I & II and Army of Darkness).  At one point a mummy's hand gets chopped off and it crawls around and tries to kill the hero (Brendan Friser).  The film also has the "magic books" that raise the dead.  Now normally these characteristics slip into film and you can't say "Hey that's like in..." But this film is crammed full of Sam Raimi traits.  All the film needed was a chain saw wheedling Bruce Campbell-isc character and they would be in a position to be sued.Now I'm not saying that the film is not good, it is a very entertaining film.  What I am saying is the following:The film is a step up from Stephen Sommers' last film Deep Rising.If you are a Sam Raimi fan and would be offended by seeing his style of writing directing don't see the Mummy, or see it and complain to all your friends.If you are a Sam Raimi fan and would be pleased to see some one use his style see the film.If you have or are going to see the film, see Evil Dead, Evil Dead II, and Army of Darkness, or any other Sam Raimi film so you can see the similarities.

Review title: A Great Movie and A must see.
Review_body: The Mummy - I believe this is one movie no one should miss.  The action of the this movie is like ID4 and love story is like Dracula not mention the stars are all beautiful people.This is by far the best combinations for Horror, Action, Comedy and love story.  I really enjoyed it and never once I feel the movie was too long. It's perfect and NOT a moment of dullness.

This is a great action film, it has the feel of the action films of yesteryear.The special effects prove that this is definitely a modern film though. From the grandeur of Ancient Egypt, to the sandstorms and plagues of the bible, the effects were flawless.One nice point,  what could have been some really gory scenes where the mummy attacks, were left to the imagination instead of trying to shock the audience.This is definitely a film that I will recommend to my friends.

There's little to like about "The Mummy" especially after the letdown I felt when going to see it. While the trailer was extremely intriguing the plot fell way short of expectations. The cardboard cutout characters were flat and lifeless. The actors were picked merely to fit set molds, including the witty adventurer, the ever degraded middle-easterners and the damsel in distress. Plot points and foreshadowing were even part of the dialogue, a sure sign of an attempt at "PG-13" campiness which sadly will only be appreciated by those 13 and under.The special effects are good, but not as good as I would have expected and they certainly do nothing to save the rest of the film which was barely a step above unwatchable. The movie is a barely disguised Keystone Cops adventure which might have been slightly more interesting if it weren't for truly different and interesting films that have already been made like "Raiders of the Lost Ark" and "The Fifth Element."I suspect the masses will enjoy this movie in large numbers because it seems most are programmed to like movies that have expensive trailers, computer-generated special effects and enormous budgets...the current defining principles of Hollywood. So see "The Mummy" if you must but prepare to be disappointed.

If you like different types of movies, you will love this.  Indiana Jones, Dracula,and any Mel Brooks film, rolled into one.  Fast paced and exciting it is a must see, even for those with older children, if they can sit through it.  A bit long but worth it.Most people will enjoy this film not just for the action, but also for the plot.  Characters that grow are an up and coming concept in Hollywood and this movie stays with the idea.  Interesting twist in the story and three dimensional characters make this a filling movie.  And a great way to prepare for the summer movies.

Review title: Worth seeing on the big screen!
Review_body: Good, solid movie entertainment. Great special effects, and decent story. I usually don't see movies in theaters if I can experience them more comfortably at home, but it was worth the extra money and time to go to see this on a big screen.  It is very "...Lost Ark"-ish, though Brendon Fraser isn't as handsome as Harrison Ford. Of course, I'm 40, and the 20 year-olds out there would probably disagree. Still...he'll do!  Plenty of action and interesting scenery. Well worth the couple of hours and the money, which is all I ask of a movie at a theater.

Quite possibly one of the poorest movies I have ever seen and I have seen quite a few in my timeWhat an all too simple story. It's a weak excuse to throw some special effects around which surprisingly weren't that good. When I saw in the credits that ILM was doing them I was ready to be blown away. Mediocre is what comes to mind when I think of the effects. A few of them are impressive but when it comes to ILM most people expect eye-popping as a standard. In one scene, the mummy who is slowly regenerating, has scabs and scars on portions of his face. For some reason they were unnecessarily computer generated. And to make it worse, they seemed to floating off his face as the effects personnel did a poor job matching the shape of the scars to the mummy's face. Quite a few times there are thousands of bugs, be it scarabs, locusts, or flies buzzing or crawling around. The sheer number is a bit impressive but what distracted me was that the bugs were shiny for some reason forcing me to realize that they were in fact computer generated.The movie's script is filled with one-liners that just aren't funny. It doesn't help when most of them are said by the leading man Brenden Frasier who for the entire movie either needs cough medicine because his voice is forcefully scratchy or curls his lip as if he had some peanut butter stuck to the front of his teeth.In addition to a poor movie, it didn't help that I was surrounded by the most annoying people...ever. At countless points, two gentlemen in front of me burst out loud with an ear-splitting laugh just screaming of stupidity. It wasn't only at the parts where the movie tried to be funny either. When one of the characters just simply got on his camel, they burst out loud with a roar of a laugh rocking back and forth in their seats. And just for the record, many other people besides me were angry at these men (oafs?). Two people behind me got up during the middle of the movie after another one of the idiots' laughs. Coincidence? I think not...I would much rather have stayed home staring at a blank wall for a couple of hours than have gone to this trash. This movie is what gives adventure/blockbuster movies a bad name.

It's one of the most fun movies I've seen since the first Indiana Jones movie.  It is filled with non-stop action, well placed humor and likeable characters.  It has, as most movies do, that unbelievable action or two, but still a fun movie.  It was also devoid of nudity, sex and extreme foul lanaguage.  I am a big movie goer and I think it's one of the best movies I've seen since Saving Private Ryan.

Review title: Wow, this movie was really lame!
Review_body: This movie was totally lame.  The writers couldn't figure out whether to make it scary and exciting, or funny, or some mixture of both.  The effects were great, but after seeing The Matrix, there was nothing special about The Mummy's.It might be a fun movie for 12 year olds, but this is not the kind of thing that'll hold me over until Phantom Menace

The special effects, adventure, and humor made this movie enjoyable in the Indiana Jones tradition.  If you can get past the historical liberties (Imhotep was the architect of the first stepped pyramid, 1500 years before Seti I), it's good fun.

Review title: The Mummy is hot, and the hero is even hotter!!
Review_body: I have seen this movie three times already and I love it!!  I would go again and again!  This movie has action, adventure, romance, beautiful scenery, a handsome hero, a beautiful heroine, the brother for comic relief, and the villain's not to shabby either.  I would recommend that if you haven't seen this movie yet, you do so immediately!  And if you have seen it, and you love it, see it again.  If you did see it, and you didn't like it, that's your problem.  The Mummy, in my opinion, was better than The Phantom Menace.

The Mummy was a pretty good movie, but there were some problems with it. First and foremost, it should have been rated R.  It could have been a much better movie had the creators tried to make it R instead of PG-13.  The intro was good, but I think a little more info about Imhotep's past would have been nice.  Also, what in the hell was Rick (the main guy) doing in the Middle East? When I first heard about The Mummy, I heard that it WOULD be rated R, and that it would be a powerful epic, which is what I was hoping for.  The final story was pretty good but could have used some work (well, the director was also the screenwriter).This movie had great potential for being a not so typical horror movie that actually had a plot, but it tripped and fell at the end.  The creators should have tried for a powerful, mind-blowing epic and not a run of the mill action/horror flick.

Review title: The Mummy - an adventure into the past
Review_body: The Mummy proved to be an eclectic combination of suspense, laughter, and adventure. Though similar in style to the Indiana Jones movies, The Mummy was still captivating and fun to watch.Take note of the wonderful scenery and special effects. It is truly monumental.The actors - mostly unknowns - were perfectly cast and put on a great performance.I would highly recommend this movie to anyone.

Obviously, advertising for the Mummy promises state-of-the-art special effects and edge-of-your-seat action.  I entered the theater with re-newed faith in the movie industry, as the last film I caught was 'The Matrix.' What did I find?First of all, the special effects in the Mummy showed a complete lack of imagination.  How many times can they show a moving skeleton?  How many times can scarabs appear in swarms out of nowhere?  Or bees, or locusts? The mummy himself was pretty cool when he first came to life, I admit, but they could have done even more with his appearance, since you get to see him up close many times.Aside from the effects, the central problem here is plot, or rather lack of one:  a cookie-cutter storyline, down to the last scene where the hero kisses the girl and they ride off into the sunset (though on camels here instead of horses).  I'll admit it was funny, very funny in parts, but I didn't go in expecting a comedy.  Movies like 'Scream' and 'Nightmare on Elm Street' could pull off making you laugh, and placing you at the edge of your seat at the same time.  This movie completely fails at that, and comes off as a complete Adventure-movie spoof.  Even 'Tremors' was better at creating tension.  Because 'The Mummy' seems to be continually making fun of itself, you never feel the wonderful suspense that made movies like 'Speed' and 'T2' superior action flicks.All in all, I'd say the movie's greatest strengths come from the comedic writing, and Brendan (who is in no way responsible for this movie's shortcomings, by the way) continually beating the s**t out of this little twerp that keeps showing up at key turning points in the film.If you must investigate the Mummy's curse, I suggest a matinee.

The Mummy squeaks in as an acceptable blockbuster. Humor, good timing, off-timing and recurring horror all come together producing a full cinema experience.The romance is a little hokey, but not ridiculously so. I thoroughly enjoyed the modesty of the lead female character. The character, Evelyn Carnarvon, was delightful, smart and a lady.Brendan Fraser once again has chosen the role of a lovable leading man. He delivers the hero talents too, lots of punches thrown and knockin' around bad guys - both living and dead.Special effects? Very well done. Spooky stuff.Story line? Mmmmmmmm... There's a gaping free fall within the movie when the goal or goals are lost. But we, the audience, are along for this ride and we're all in this together. We're still having an acceptable night at the movies.About the humor... much of it was great. But I was upon saying the words to my husband as Brendan Fraser said my line. Granted, I'm a funny person, but that line must have been waiting there to be said. I struggle with it being a trite line or I'm a witty person of the same caliber as the screenwriter. (grin) Other than that and one completely flat line delivered by the character Beni deep into the film, the humor was good.This is a remake of an old horror film, and is "as good as can be expected." There will be better films. But if the previews attracted you to the desert mystery, you won't be disappointed.

i fell in love with the mummy- the priest, arnold vosloo. this movie was romantic, and i mean in detail, not a mushy, date movie. not many curse words (one said under brendans' breath), no sex scenes (although someone in the theatre did make a catcall when they saw the mistress' painted butt near the beginning of the movie). great fx! i am planning to see it again this weekend and want to own a copy as soon as it comes to video!

I couldn't figure out if this movie was intended to be a comedy or a drama. No matter, though, it was terrible either way. I suppose I was expecting new Indiana Jones-type movie, but the acting was terrible and the action scenes disappointing.It's too bad, as the storyline could have been much more intruiging. The reason I gave it a 3 was due to *some* decent special effects (face in the sandstorm was the highlight.In any case, it's worth missing. See it on video or a $1 theatre if you must.

Universal Studios' production of The Mummy is a first-rate movie of entertainment that has something for everyone - a little romance, great comedy, action, scary thrills and chills!My preference, of course, is for the character of,who else,but the Mummy, portrayed wonderfully by actor Arnold Vosloo (why haven't we seen more of this actor before and I hope that we will in the near future).  His portrayal of Imhotep is fascinating and intriguing with a definite screen presence.  Being a fan of the horror classics, I thoroughly enjoyed every minute of this movie twice!!The scenery and the amount of work that went into this production was extensive and added richly to the film.  The computerized imagery was fascinating and it very much added to the visual effects of the movie.The soundtrack for The Mummy is a mind-movie in itself with the flavors of Egyptian sounds and the scoring of the soundtrack added just the right touch to the various scenes involving the different characters.As for myself, I can't wait until this movie is available on video and I've just ordered the soundtrack.  All I want now is a poster from The Mummy autographed by Arnold Vosloo!!

Review title: Said it how I saw it
Review_body: This movie was very good, a little slow in the beginning, but after things picked up and the plot thickened, it became a must see. Realism was not an issue in this movie, for it went on a lot of stories and wives tales, which made for a very interesting flick because of the freedom of the director. Made me cling to my seat and beg for more...it even left itself open for a sequel.

Review title: Tries to be Indiana Jones but comes closer to Quatermain
Review_body: The Mummy is one of the worst movies I´ve seen this year. I guess it is meant to be a mixture of Indiana Jones and old-school horror movies with more special effects, but it doesn´t even come close to Quatermain. Bad actors, poor dialogues and a mummy that moves like Terminator. I only rated it a 2 because of the first ten minutes.

Review title: Great action & adventure, and cool special effects
Review_body: Although this is not of the genre of the old "atmospheric" monster movies, ie The Mummy series, Dracula, The Wolfman, it is one of the better efforts I have seen from today's "idea" of horror flicks.  Most of the monsters these days look so cheesy, it's laughable, and they make up for it, with blood and gore. The scarabs, the mummy himself, plus all those horrid mummy servants of his, were a joy to watch.  I've seen it 3 times, and I still jump at certain points of the movie. This is one I will have in my video library.

This was one of approximately two movies in my entire life that I actually walked out of.  Nothing but irritating.  Not funny.  Not scary.  Not interesting.  Not sexy.  I hated both the main characters intensely.  And I love all kinds of movies.  I love things like City of Lost Children as well as old Audrey Hepburn movies.  I can enjoy something as stupid as Phenomenon as well as something brilliant like Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf.  I love Hollywood--things like Face-Off or Independence Day. . .  I am usually very positive about movies I see.  But unless you are a complete imbecile, there is NOTHING in this movie that will entertain you.  Beware The Mummy.

Indy can save the day...oops wrong movie.  But to tell you the truth it is nothing like an Indy Flik.  This film has a good story and the acting was decent.  As i watched this movie i had a feeling that all the actors and actresses had a blast making this movie.  and that makes for a fun filled movie.  i was impressed with this one and i will stick by my guns when anyone disses this flick.  Any time i can go to a movie and be entertained i feel good and that is exactly what this movie was FUN  8 out of 10

Review title: Neither funny nor scary...not good at all!
Review_body: A film about THE Mummy should either be a Boris Karloff white knuckle, terror movie or an Abbott & Costello - type comedy. This film failed miserably at being either either. (Only the Indiana Jones type movies can successfully combine excitement, adventure and humour - simply because they were the first genre to be successful at it).The acting in The Mummy was ATROCIOUS.   John Hannah, what were you thinking of, man? I gave the film 3/10 purely because of the effects, which were excellent and which soaked up 95% of the budget I would imagine! However, this film is proof positive that computers alone cannot create a good movie.Give it a miss, or if you must wait until it's on Cable!

Excellent! The Mummy is the best movie I've ever seen. The talent of the actresses/actors are phenomenal. Also, the special effects were awesome and kept me glued to my seat. I invite everyone to see a flick that'll keep them coming back for more. I should know, I've seen The Mummy 3 times.The one person that I couldn't get out of my head is Oded Fehr. He's a great actor and very easy on the eyes.

Review title: I only walked out on 3 movies in my life, this was one of them.
Review_body: Horrid! Cartoon-like special effects--& the actors are irritating--also did I mention boring? You really have to be in the right mood to enjoy this movie--the trouble is I can't  imagine what one might do to achieve this blissful state.
a typical effects movie with bad stereotypical characters and an awful story. Had some cool fantasy inspired visuals but thats all and that doesnt make a film.

Review title: Could have been great but for the cheese
Review_body: What could have been a fantastic horror movie was marred by the fact that the film had to follow the "Hollywood Blockbuster" step-by-step guide.  If you like a cheesy, not too taxing film, with a flash hero, beautiful girl, 'funny' man, super powerful villain and sad, pitiful side-kick, that follows the age-old good against evil plot, then you'll find this is a must see film. If on the other hand, you're not, then it still is a reasonable film to see with respect to the great effects and a tie-in with one of the great horror classics.

I went to see The Mummy and I was expecting an exciting movie...instead I saw a complete selection of bollocks. Hilarious and horror merge with a drop of fiction and American teaching. A complete waste of money.....waiting for Star Wars

Review title: A good candidate for worst film '99
Review_body: The only thing going for this was the trailer which made it out to be quite an atmospheric horror/action flick.  Oh dear.  What went wrong...Absolutely no atmosphere and not horrific in the slightest the film seemed to lose the plot whilst it was still setting the scene (which seemed to take hours in itself).The only slightly redeeming quality was that it was SO bad it was in places laughable.

A good film with some fantastic sfx.....but what was missing? Perhaps a bullwhip, fedora and Harrison Ford?This film was blatently written to be Indy 4 (or should have been).  There were characters such as John Hannah who could just as easily been Marcus Brody from the Indy trilogy.The American team that they were competing against could have been the Nazi's from the other films.Other 'trademarks' were the occurance of the "swarm" (snakes, bugs, rats and now scarabs).  To top it all off, at the end there was even the classic Indy dive under the door.Other than that a good film, but I was just waiting for the "de de de da, da de da" (doesn't work without a sound card) :-)
For this movie i need only few words: very horrible script, pathetic actors, unbelievable story. Excuse for this comment but i prefer "The Mummy" 1932. I hope Mummy kills this director !!

Review title: An AWFUL horror/thriller, maybe a good comedy ...
Review_body: I believe this movie was meant to be a comedy. Otherwise I would have to consider it as a mockery to one's intelligence. I warn everybody who wants to see a good horror: Beware of this one !

In an age of movies that try to push limits, it is nice to have a movie that just tries to tell a story and pull it off well.  While there may not have been enough sex or blood-and-guts for some folk, I feel this is one of the best "scary" movies ever.  I prefer to be scared a la "Rear Window" -- what is imagined is better than what is seen.  "The Mummy" stirs up emotions while making one feel a part of the action -- or within the whirlwind of action as the Mummy runs amok.  Can't wait for the sequel.  Who cares if it wins no accolades?  As long as it delivers what the first did, I will watch it -- again and again.

Review title: One of the most fun movies I have ever seen.
Review_body: "The Mummy" surprised the heck out of me. I went in expecting a horror film and was riveted to the screen for the next two hours. This movie has it all: action, adventure, romance, comedy, drama, suspense, horror, foreign language subtitled. The special effects were incredible, putting even Star Wars: The Phantom Menace to shame (interesting, because both movies' effects were produced by Industrial Light and Magic...). Imhotep makes Jar Jar Binks look incredibly fake. The  Jerry Goldsmith score fits the movie well, adding to the Egyptian feel. Definitely in my top ten all-time favorite list!

This looked really good in the commercials, but did the actual movie ever suck! The effects weren't that impressive, and the acting was really bad. It wasn't at all scary, and the action wasn't that entertaining. What a waste of 8 dollars!

The first few minutes were enticing; exotic costumes, language, and sets weaved nicely together to create a plausibly depicted ancient Egypt. But then *flash!* Three thousand years later...We're treated to shameless silliness as a bunch of slapstick, clever-line-dropping, cut-from-movie-dough characters annoy us through a cartoonish exploration of an ancient city and the accidental awakening of an (ooh) fearsome mummy.We're treated to numerous repeated, forehead-slapping devices like roaring matches between the beefcake hero and the poorly-computer-animated undead; the endless supply of hapless, gutless, yelping sidekick characters; the ditzy, studious, utterly incomprehensible female lead.Perhaps worst, we're treated to a faux-1920s setting populated by unapologizingly 1990s dialogue ("Like I've never heard that before!") among other blatant anachronisms. Why not just set it in the present, I wonder? Oh yeah, Indiana Jones.The best summary, I suppose, is given by the beefcake hero: "Save the damsel in distress, kill the bad guy, save the world." At least the movie has a sense of humor about its own lack of depth.

When I first saw the previews for this movie, I thought that I wasn't going to like it.  When we rented it, I hadn't even planned on watching it...I was more interested in doing my homework.  But once I started watching it, I was hooked!!  I watched it the next morning, and I went out and bought it the next day.  Now I can watch it whenever I want to, which is great because it is a great movie and I can't get enough of Brendan Fraser!!

This movie had it all. Action, adventure, romance!! Finally a mature role for Brandon Frasier. i really enjoyed watching him in this one. he had the exact same style as he did in his other movies, but they were useful to keep the movie going. One person i would like to see more of is Oded Fahr, who played the mysterious Ardeth Bay. he just added a sense of fear and danger to the scenes that he was in. Overall, a wonderful movie!!

Review title: Lots Of Fun If You Don't Take It (Or Yourself) Too Seriously
Review_body: I put off seeing this movie for months because I let myself get turned off by the bad reviews that were given to it by serious film buffs (the kind of people who talk oh-so-knowingly about "genre" and are probably boring as hell in real life). Finally saw it ... and guess what? I liked it!The movie is misclassified as horror. It's really a comedy with high-grade special effects. I've seen plenty of comments here comparing it to Indiana Jones. I had that impression, too. That's one of the things I liked about it. The acting's not great, but the actors are cute. The dialogue is corny. However, there are some surprises and the special effects are certainly eye-catching.If you like your mummies slow, stick with the classic stuff. But, if you enjoy something a little off the wall, this movie is a fun way to spend a couple of hours.

Not a bad film, it's certainly not a masterpiece, but it's a pleasant way to fill in an hour or two.  The special effects were impressive, the actors were solid, the script 'though predictable was witty with its tongue firmly planted in its cheek.  This film played on many levels but fell just short in every single one of them.What can I say...  It was...  O.K.

Review title: It is the best movie I have seen in a long time
Review_body: I think this movie is the best one made in a long time and it just brought me in with it.  This movie has shown me that any thing is possible in life if you will just go after it. It is a great movie for every one to watch.

Review title: Great fun. Just don't take it seriously
Review_body: I really enjoyed this movie.  I thought that it had a great combination of humor, action, romance, and just plain fun.  Although The Mummy is not on the level of the Indiana Jones franchise, I found myself reminded of Harrison Frod beating up the Nazis and claiming the ark of the covenant!!!

Review title: Good clean fun in the Land of Mysteries
Review_body: What a wonderful and adventurous time.From the tale of forbidden love to the Lost City and beyond, you will not be bored. Sitting on the edge of your seat waiting to see what happens next is half the fun.  Enjoy!

Wow, The Mummy Is AWESOME!!!! What a great film, fun, romantic, Perfect!!!!I absolutely loved it!!! It's my favorite movie! Great Actors, amazing special effects, Funny, edgy, with protagonists who truly are. Rick O'Connel is a true hero, a plain dealer. We don't see  too many of those lately. Evie is thankfully so much more than the Hood Ornament we usually see in adventure films, one that usually tends to get replaced in the sequel. Gladly Rachel Weisz will be in The Mummy 2. Her character is irreplaceable.

Review title: Many drawbacks in the scenario, only the special effects deserve credit.
Review_body: The major thing that I didn't like in this movie is the way it presents Ancient Egyptians and their civilisation. They present them like people who were worshipping evil and exercising black magic. Totally wrong. Ancient Egyptians were lively people, who believed in Good and loved good life. In fact their whole life was considered as a fight against the forces of darkness and the chaos. They were preserving the bodies of the Pharaohs and other important people, so that they could live in a sense forever.Of course, the resurrection of a dead to a deadly beast is a potentially very good starting point for a horror/action story/movie. But this is not enough. It is easy to spoil everything if you are careless about the details. And I explain. The city of Hamunaptra is totally fictitious. There was never such a city, and especially a city of the Dead. Priest Imhotep (later the mummy) is the bad, evil guy. But in the Ancient Egyptian history there is a priest Imhotep, who was considered a very wise man and he did many things for the benefit of Egypt (unfortunately, I don't remember right now many details about him). Later, his fame was such that he was even worshipped as a god. Definitely, the choice of the name was awkward. Close to the end of the movie, the Book of the Dead is being used, presented as a secret book of black magic. Although there IS a Book of the Dead, it has nothing to do with the way it is presented in the movie. In fact, the Book of the Dead accompanied every Pharaoh, it has been found and it is a guide for the dead Pharaoh about how he will be judged by the Gods in the other world and other things. It has nothing to do with black magic. Concerning the second book the heroes use, that does not exist even by name. And all these strange names of the Gods, where have they found them? Non of them exists in the Egyptian mythology!If you don't know anything at all about Ancient Egypt, these things will pass unnoticed. You might even like them! But seriously, if you have read something about Ancient Egypt, then you notice them, and they are very annoying, spoiling much of the fun. The movie refers to another, Hollywood Egypt, not the real one. And since the movie fails to have a realistic background, it fails to entertain (at least it failed with me).But these are not the only drawbacks of the movie. Brendan Fraser is not convincing as an action hero, Rachel Weisz tries unsuccessfully to be the female and for the rest...So, to conclude, you might ask if I didn't like anything in this movie at all. Not quite, after all I gave it a 3. The effects were amazing, maybe the only decent thing in this movie. I think that they are the main, if only, making it such a success. Therefore, the only one that deserves full credit, are the Silicon Graphics.

Review title: A must for Indiana Jones fans
Review_body: I thought this movie was really good it was a good escape from reality for 2 hours and is a must for Indiana Jones fans. Brendan Fraser was at his very best no doubt about that playing the mummy slayer Rick. Rachel Weisz played the damsel in distress really good so did John Hannah whom played her brother he added some great humour to the movie. This movie is a must for all you adventure types you can,t go wrong. I forgot to mention the guy who played the mummy Arnold Vosloo he does not say much but he put forward to me you don,t mess with him. And watch out for the bugs!

Review title: The movie sustained my attention with the light humor and vigorous performance by the lead actor and actress.
Review_body: The choice of cast was excellent as the beautiful heroine was a cross between the damsel in distress and the strong Cleopatra. She had a sense of mystery and danger even in her portrayal of a librarian. Brendan Fraser was as handsome as ever and provided the element of farce to the genre of horror and I believe that was a key element in keeping the audiences attention. It breaks the confines of a horror and brinks on adventure, romance. All in all it is uplift for dull day and a visual feast as both leads light up the screen with their chemistry.

After seeing the trailers which only showed the great F/X and computer wizzardry they put into the movie, the movie itself was a great disappointement. The characters are poor, the story thin and historically it is next to blasphamy. I was wondering what audience this was aimed at: when you cut the 'scary' scenes, it would be a good movie for kids! As an adult, I felt tested as to howmuch I could take. This movie is (in my opinion) another example where the makers thought they could get away with some nice computer F/X. But they seem to forget that these things only support a movie, not carry it. You still need a good story and some convincing actors to play it. I'm not against computer F/X, but they can't make up a poorly put together movie. Maybe the plot worked in the 30's, but we're not in Kansas anymore...One good thing after seeing this movie: I didn't rent it (my brother did...) - so I didn't waste any money.

Review title: A film full of fun and adventure!
Review_body: A lot of people I know didn't like "The mummy". Well, I really enjoyd it, because I knew what sort of movie I've been watching. If you hear about the title and the story of "The mummy", you expect a horror-movie with a lot of dead people and a lot of blood. If you expect that, you will be disappointed. "The mummy" is a classic adventure film, with some very funny moments in it. You are able to see, that the actors had a lot of fun during the shooting. If you are looking for two hours full of fun and adventure: choose "the mummy".

Review title: The best movie I have ever seen
Review_body: When I first went to see the movie, I didn't expect anything. But it was great and I went back to the cinema to see it for 5 times. This movie has it all: action, humor, romance and of course a great cast. Before The Mummy I had never heard of Arnold Vosloo, Oded Fehr, Stephen Dunham and Corey Johnson. And now I think they are great actors. For anyone who thinks this is a copy of one of the Indiana Jones films: it is not true. Indiana Jones wasn't about Mummies!

Review title: It has become one of my top ten. I quote, so this could be a spoiler.
Review_body: This movie has become one of my favorites.  I used to stay up late to watch the old mummy movies when I was a kid.  Ever since then I've been intrigued by the whole ancient egyptian thing.  Now, this movie does get down right ridiculous towards the end, but if I wanted reality I would sit on my front porch and watch my neighbors mow their lawn (for free.)  As ridiculous as it gets, the acting is really good.  The humor is contemporary, and so out of place; but I'm willing to make that leap for the sake of a good laugh.Here's were I start to spoil it a bit.  I really got to say that I thought the acting was really authentic.  I have never seen anyone stutter as convincingly as Rick when he was giving Evie the tools he stole - and the look on his face...he really looked nervous.  In fact the facial expressions were really bang on for nearly everyone.  The evil smile of Vasloo was perfect.  When he did the plane swallowing sand/body wave thing...that was wierd, but cool.  He was totally into it.  Like an evil dude would be.  In all fairness, The mumbled stutters Evie forced out when the claw guy asked her for the map sounded very real.  They could rival Rick's tool gift stutters.  Speaking of real, how do you make it look like someone is running into a wall full speed, head first? I don't know, but they do.This movie had a nice amount of humor sprinkled throughout.  Some of the best lines you should hear are..."sounds like.....bugs."  The facial really did it for me on that one.  I was surprised how funny Fraser could be.  The air kiss was a hoot.  "That happens alot around here" -was well placed. Other great lines are..."what's that God awful stench?-Oh", also "You don't have any children"-"I might some day", and "Wait here I'll go get help." This is the kind of humor that, I (being intelligent yet silly) can laugh at over and over. They picked the right people for the roles in this movie.  Benny was a total weasel.  I hope I don't offend him, but this guy yelled weasel from his sandals to his hat.  His voice, his lines, his stance, his smile- he was the perfect weasel.  Jonathan (the brother) was great.  There wasn't a moment I didn't believe this guy.  Speaking of guys how many good looking men can you fit in one movie?  I counted at least four.  The magi leader was a babe. (Also, I appreciated that they spoke Egyptian were appropriate.)  Now if you're talking babe material- truthfully I first saw the movie because it had mummy in the title and I knew Fraser (God's gift to us women) was in it. But- the last four times I saw it were mostly for Vasloo.  Where did this guy come from and does he have any brothers?  Yow-za!  You gotta envy Evie when she has Rick(a modern John Wayne with a splash of Tom Hanks) and Imohtep (a gorgeous face on top of an 'ouch' body) fighting over her.I heard about the sequal and I'm definitely gonna see it, but one thing...according to the films at the Museum of Natural History (Smithsonian), they don't remove your heart during mummification.

Review title: on how much i love this movie!
Review_body: The mummy is on my top ten list with star wars and star trek. The mummy is number one on my list and i am glad there is going to be an second movie about it. Also i am glad that they used the same actors. i hope it will be as good as the original. the original was quite possibly the best movie i have ever saw and quite possibly the best movie i will ever see. i love the mummy soundtrack. i would love to see a video game about the movie the mummy. So heres one mummy fan saying that i loved the mummy!

The Mummy is a funny movie, without presumption. The cast is well-chosen, the script is ironic and The Mummy with Karloff (obvious comparison) is enough far: more dramatic and evocative. A different thing!

Review title: My favorite movie of all time!!!
Review_body: What about The Mummy. I watched when I was 8 years old and for sure, this is my favorite movie of all time. I have always been interested in the mysteries of ancient Egypt and this magnificent work only came to contribute my interest in the subject. Fantastic, timeless and a true masterpiece of cinema.

Review title: a great movie for children daddys and mostly MUMMY'S
Review_body: a must see for every one. the best brendan movie ever. great acting children will shout i want my mummy after watching this.

Review title: Rescue the damsel in distress, kill the bad guy, save the world.
Review_body: What's not to like about a plot like that?  (It doesn't hurt that the damsel is as gorgeous as this one.)  This is the best action/adventure flick since Indiana Jones, and I'm looking forward to the sequel.  For future sequels, they should try different villains: The Vampire, The Werewolf, etc.

What can I say, my sister thinks this movie was a total waste of time. I however loved it. The special FX were fabulous, a shout-out goes to my fellow country man Arnold, you made a handsome mummy..never thought that I would think of you as handsome. Benny made the film a riot as he was such a total creep. The Egyptian jailer as well, he was a total skunk, I laughed everytime he came on, even when he killed himself :o) The relationship between Evie and Rick was a pleasure to watch mainly because he's so charming/goofy and she's so, I don't know."strict-watch your manners-nun like." The movie was throughly entertaining and has been added to my list of all time favorite movies, which consists of : Armeggedon and Ben-Hur. I recommend this to anyone who likes a good adventure story.

There are some movies in life, that you can't get bored of, even if you watch it eight times a day for two weeks, (which i have) i could not get over the excellent adaptation of the original plot line. Witty comments had me in stitches and thrill after thrill kept me on the edge of my seat for the entire movie. It will definitely be in my top 10 for many years to come. A movie containing action, drama and romance. What could be better? Fort me nothing could beat it. Acting by the leads, Brendan Fraser(Rick o'Connell), and Rachel Wiesz(Evelyn Carnahan) was absolutely fantastic! If anyone asked my for my favourite movie, it would definitely be this.

When I first saw the movie, I was enthralled with all of the computer graphics - Im-ho-tep as a gruesome mummy, the different creatures etc. I loved every moment of the movie. I recently bought it and I am not sick of it yet. So if you enjoy the historical fantasy - The Mummy is the movie for you.

this is completely brainless FUN!!!! and that's precisely why I like it. of course, the opportunity to see Ardeth Bay in action once again it's another reason, but....that one I can't elaborate or else the 1000 words limit will be broken.....

This movie is complete with a great plot, amazing special effects, and hilarious humor. Im not the one to sit down and watch action movies but this one really sucked me in. With all the mummies roaming around it had its little horror moments, but with the cast it had like Brendan Frasier you are sure to laugh quite a few times. The battle scenes and the scene where the army of mummies were coming towards the pyramid was amazing, and the sound is incredible you feel like your in the movie theater. I say this is a great movie, and you don't really have to be into action and adventure to like it, and i know im not really into the whole indiana jones thing but this movie i say is for almost everyone.

A fun ride from start to finish, brilliant cast along with exceptionally well written characters. I would regard this above any Indiana Jones film without hesitation. This is what any blockbuster/ adventure movie should aspire to.10/10

If you love Indiana Jones movies, you'll like this one. Obviously, Brandon Fraser is not as good as Harrison Ford but at least special effects (both audio and video) are pretty good. Unfortunately there's too much comedy stuff in it (e.g. Fraser yawning at mummies) but you'll have nice 2 hours watching it, and you'll not be scared.

About 3 years ago, my Mom & dad rented The Mummy. That night me and my family watched it. It was safe to say... I hated it! It made no sense to me. But of chorus I was only 11 at the time. About a year ago, my brother taped it off of HBO. I got really board one night and watched it. From that night on. I've loved it. It was a perfect mix of Good acting, superb effaces and a great part of history that we all know about. I've had a lot of lost dreams in mylife but my new dream and the one that I'm holding on to, I'm going to be an Egyptologist. It sounds stupid but that movie made me know what I wanted to do with my life.
Loved this movie as a kid, still watchable today, a fun little time capsule to when blockbusters were big dumb fun times at the cinema.
Best movie ever. 👏🏻 Cannot recommend this movie enough. Watch it!
A childhood favorite that still holds up to this day. Glad it's starting to get the recognition it deserves.

Review title: Long time fan of the movie, but a few things always rankle me
Review_body: It is borne of the Indiana Jones type of old-fashioned adventure.
